En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como: dulces, chicles, galletas, gaseosas y otras cosas más. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosario belongs to the communal bank “Patrón de San Sebastián” from the city of Cusco.  She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in that same city where she was born.  She is 65 years old and married, and as a result of that relationship, she has 6 children.  Her primary business activity is selling snacks in one of the bus terminals in the city of Cusco.  It has been several years since she started her business, and it is going very well for her.  At this moment, she needs a loan to buy merchandise like candies, gum, cookies, sodas, and more.  She is happy to be getting a loan and she promises that she will make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sweets, gum, cookies, soda, and other items.

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es: Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. Ella es profesora y trabaja en una ONG en un proyecto como coordinadora de vaso de leche además ella vende tejidos a hechos a mano. Ella vende sus tejidos los días sábados en una feria sabatina de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nancy’s a member of the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  She was born in Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  She’s 47-years-old, married and has four children.  She’s a teacher employed by an NGO as a coordinator in a “Vaso de Leche” program [“Glass of Milk” - Government-Sponsored Infant, Child and Pregnant Mother nutritional program].  She also sells hand-knitted items.  She sells them on Saturdays at a Saturday street market in Cusco.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy yarn.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Él nació en la provincia de Apuricma pero vive en la provincia de Urubamba.  Él es chofer y trabaja brindando servicio de transporte inter provincial de la ruta Cusco - Urubamba y viceversa.  Él solicita el crédito para  hacer mantenimiento del carro y por lo tanto va comprar  llantas y repuestos. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Víctor continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank in the city of Urubamba.  He was born in Apuricma Province abut lives in Urubamba Province.  He’s a driver and works providing inter-provincial transportation service on the Cusco-Urubamba route and vice-versa.  He requests the loan to service the car; he will buy tires and spare parts. He’s happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
Patience's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Patience is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Patience has been working hard to manage her clothing sales' business.

To help expand her business, Patience has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more clothes for resale purposes, which Patience expects will help her to generate an increase in profits and to care for her siblings. In the future, Patience hopes to be able to expand her business.

Patience is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a resident of Kisii, South Rift, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and their four children between the ages of ten and three years. She has been farming for five years and currently sells her produce of bananas, maize, vegetables, and milk at the local market.

Zipporah has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to own at least five dairy cows to ensure that she is able improve her family's health and provide for their basic needs. She mentioned that the majority of her family's needs are met with her farming income, but improving her farming income will improve the livelihood of her entire family.

Zipporah says the major challenge in farming is animal diseases. She is happy with Juhudi Kilimo's provision of farming loans, with a major focus on smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: Las Rosas son un grupo trabajador que ha luchado por superarse y llegar hasta donde están. Rosa es una de las integrantes, tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 14 años, ambos estudian. Ella es comerciante de ropa y zapatos y el crédito lo utilizara para comprar un pedido grande de los mismos para la temporada de frio. Algo que Rosa desea comprar es un carro, ya que le seria muy útil para ir a surtir la mercancía y hacer sus cobros semanales.
texts.en: Las Rosas is a hard-working group that fought to excel and get to where they are today. Rosa is one of the members. She is 33 years old, is married and has 2 children who are 4 and 14 years old. Both of her children study. She is a shopkeeper selling clothing and shoes, and will use the loan to buy a large order of these items for the cold season. Something that Rosa would like to buy is a cart, as it would be very useful for her to go and buy supplies of merchandise and do her weekly collections.

loans.use: to buy a large order of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Member Good Group

texts.en: Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in the town of Lungi 37 years ago. She is married to a police officer, and the couple have 3 children: 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Aminata sells children's clothes and has been a businesswoman for 19 years now. Aminata and her group members have applied for a loan of 3,600,000 Leones from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to increase their business inventories. This will lead to more sales, better profit and improvement in their standard of living. Aminata will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Leones) to buy more children’s clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more children’s clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a farmer and a father of three young children, the first born of which is already in school. He has been in farming for over twenty years and currently runs his farming business with the help of three farmhands. His major produce includes coffee, tea, milk, sorghum and maize. He runs a retail shop to earn additional income. Evans has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says improved milk production will help improve the livelihood of his family and allow him to educate his children. He remains optimistic about the growth of his business and expects the burden of educating his children to be eased. His future plan is to buy more parcels of land for overall expansion of his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various animal feeds for resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. Ella trabaja en una empresa donde se elabora artesanías como: joyas, mantas y cerámicas. Su jornal laboral empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. de lunes a viernes. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda elaborar y vender artesanía. Solicita el crédito para hacer mantenimiento de la casa a propósito va hacer refaccionar las paredes. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Marlene continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.  She works in a firm that manufactures crafts like jewelry, blankets and ceramics.  Her work day starts at 8am and goes until 6pm Monday through Friday.  She supports her children by means of this job.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can make and sell crafts.  She’s requesting the loan to do some home improvements; she will repair the walls.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to repair the walls.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y trabaja como docente en un colegio. Su jornal laboral empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. Por medio de este trabajo la socia sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño ha sido siempre mejorar sus conocimientos como docente. Solicita el crédito para hacer mantenimiento de la casa por lo tanto va comprar pintura y accesorios de baño. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Haydee continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and working as a teacher in a school.  Her work day goes from 8am until 6pm and she supports her family by means of this job.  Her dream has always been to improve her skills as a teacher.  She requests the loan to do some home improvements.  She will buy paint and bathroom accessories.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy paint and bathroom accessories.

loans.name: Leonor Yanet

texts.es: Leonor tiene 35 años de edad y nació en la ciudad del Cusco pero vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Ella   continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y trabaja en la venta de celulares además a la venta de artesanía, pero desea abrir una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Leonor, 35, was born in Cusco but lives in Urubamba.  She continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and works selling mobile phones and crafts but wants to open a grocery store.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y en la venta de flores como rosas, claveles y otras más. Su jornal laboral empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Marcelina continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and selling flowers like roses, carnations and others.  Her work day starts at 8am and ends at 6pm.  She supports her children by means of this business.  She requests the loan to buy seeds and manure.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 24 years old and he is from Gaza.  He owns a shop for auto repair and auto accessories.  He has been in business for three years and is also considered the main distributer for similar shops.

He has requested a youth loan from Ryada in order to buy an air conditioner, shelving and car motors.  He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and provide his wife with the best life he can afford.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, shelving and car motors.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a farmer in Ndunyu, Njeru Town, where he plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes as well as vegetables.  He is 58 years old and married to Dorcas.  They have two children, who are now in high school.

This is his fourth loan, and he plans to buy farm necessities, which include fertilizer and seedlings.  He anticipates making more profits from the sale of the maize and beans harvest.  He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

Paul hopes to improve his farming methods and to become one of the leading cash crop farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy farm necessities such as fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy continua en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y como profesora del nivel primario en una escuela de la ciudad de Urubamba, además se dedica a la producción y venta de semilla de papa. Ella es una persona responsable que saca adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Noemy continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and working as an elementary school teacher in one of Urubamba’s schools.  She also works producing and selling potato seeds.  She’s a responsible person who supports her family.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy manure.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Julia Josefina

texts.es: Julia continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y en la elaboración de cerámica como: adornos, aretes y collares. Con el anterior préstamo le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento de la casa va pintar las habitaciones entonces va comprar pintura. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julia continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and making clay crafts like decorations, earrings and necklaces.  She did very well with the previous loan and was able to earn good profits.  On this occasion she needs the loan to do some home improvements.  She’s going to paint the bedrooms so needs to buy paint.  Her dream is to open a grocery store.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y en la elaboración de artesanía. Él trabaja en la producción de tejidos como chompas, guantes, mantas en base de lana de alpaca. Su jornal laboral empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito para hacer mantenimiento de hogar y para la alimentación de sus hijos. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Emilio continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and making crafts.  He works weaving such things as sweaters, gloves and blankets out of Alpaca wool.  His work day starts at 8am and ends at 7pm.  He supports his family by means of this business.  He requests the loan to do some home improvements and to feed his children.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to do some home improvements and to feed his children.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y en el negocio de crianza de animales menores, además se dedica a la agricultura. Su sueño es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Camilo continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and in the business of raising small farm animals; he also works in agriculture.  His dream is to expand the animal husbandry and the agriculture business.  He requests the loan to buy seeds and to buy animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ramdan

texts.en:
Ramdan is 60 years old and he is from Gaza.  He is married and has four children.  He has owned a small grocery store since 2008.

He has requested this loan from Ryada in order to buy a refrigerator and some food as well as to enlarge and develop the space of the store.  He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and provide his children with the best life he can offer.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some food as well as to enlarge and develop his store.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: La señora Deysi tiene 36 años vive en la zona de la Maica Central Parada 3, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar está casada con Dorio, la actividad lechera en la zona es intensiva, tienen buen hato lechero que manejan familiarmente, entregan toda su producción a la Planta Industrializadora de Leche, su ganado es de raza mejorada, trabajan en los terrenos que la madre de ella le heredará para su actividad, los insumos para la actividad está muy alto en costo y necesitan capital de operación les ha faltado cáscara de soya, parte de la dieta del ganado que se consume en mayor proporción en la época de invierno porque los pastos son escasos.  El esposo se dedica a la chapería de movilidades en la misma zona tiene un pequeño taller en la misma casa, también trabaja con la actividad lechera, todo ello para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Deysi is 36 years old and lives in the District of Maica Central Parada #3, an area known for its intensive level of dairy farming. She is married to Dorio and they have two school-age children. They have managed their family business, a dairy farm, very well. Everything they produce is delivered to “Planta Industrialadora de Leche” (a South American dairy processing company). Their dairy cows are pure-bred.

Deysi and her husband work on the land that she inherited from her mother. The prices of supplies for her dairy are very expensive and she needs operating capital to buy soybean husks since this component makes up part of the diet for her cows. Grasses are scarce during the winter season, so her cows consume mostly soybean husks.

In addition to working at the dairy, her husband performs auto body repairs in this same area and has a small repair shop at home. Everything that Deysi and her husband do is geared toward improving the living conditions for themselves and their children.

loans.use: to buy soybean husks for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Ms Rozi is 34 years old and the mother of two children.  She realized that her husband could not manage everything from his salary so she decided to assist him by contributing to the family income. 

For the past four years, she has been in the business of selling decorations for the home.  She offers artificial flowers in different colors for the adornment of houses.  She also knows the art of making decorative pieces at home.  She earns enough to lead a decent life while her husband is employed in the private sector. 

When she learned about Kashf, she took out a loan and purchased some raw materials, which resulted in an increase in her monthly earnings.  At present she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR in order to purchase good quality mud of different types, artificial flowers and paints in large quantity from the market at lower rates.  In this way she will be able to increase her sales, which ultimately helps her generate more income.  She desires to expand her business and intends to utilize the earned revenue to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality mud of different types, artificial flowers and paints.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 36 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Giovanna trabaja en una empresa privada donde se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía como pintura, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros, ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 7 de la noche de lunes a sábados. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Giovanna en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento de la casa va comprar pintura y cemento. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio de elaboración de artesanía.
texts.en: Giovanna, 36, has a son.  She was born in the city of Urubamba and still lives there.  Giovanna’s employed in a private firm where crafts like paintings, decorations, utensils, jewelry, murals and sculptures, among others are manufactured.  She works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night Monday through Saturday.  She’s been working for several years and does very well due to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Giovanna needs the loan to do some home improvements.  She will buy paint and cement.  Her dream is to have her own crafts-making business.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” y en la elaboración de cuadros de pintura. Su jornal laboral empieza desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. de lunes a sábados. Ya son varios años que trabaja en esta entidad privada y le va muy bien en su trabajo gracias al empeño que pone. Por medio de este trabajo sale adelante. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como: arena, cemento para terminar de construir su casa. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María Teresa continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and manufacturing paintings.  Her work day starts at 8am and ends at 6pm, Monday through Saturday.  She’s been employed by this private firm for several years now and she does very well at work thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She gets ahead by means of this job.  Her dream is to finish building her house.  She requests this loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand and cement to finish building her house.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and a business lady; she is single but supports her parents. She has been selling gas cylinders for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to fulfill basic needs. 

Lilian will use the loan to buy complete gas cylinders. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to buy complete gas cylinders in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To buy complete gas cylinders.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Ms. Asia is 43 years old and the mother of five children.  For 15 years, Asia has been running a business selling milk.  She began her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner.  With the passage of time both her sales and her income increased.  At present, she owns four buffaloes and two cows.  This has all happened due to her hard work and determination.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters.  Her husband is happy with the growth of her business. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of triumph she got by building a new room in her house.  She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR in order to purchase another buffalo.  She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business.  

She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a resident of Nyamira and has been in farming for eight years. He runs his farm with the help of three farmhands, producing and selling milk, beans, peas, sorghum and eggs, for the local market. He sells second-hand shoes for additional income.

Edward has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy poultry birds. He says this expansion of the business will provide income to meet his family's needs and take care of his four children, especially the first two who are already in school.

He says poultry diseases remain a threat to business, but he remains optimistic the business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma una señora de 38 años cuyo esfuerzo y sacrificio tienen un solo fin que es su familia. Junto a Edgar su pareja y padre de sus 3 niños Jordi, Kevin y Yoselin, ha sido siempre el motor y cabeza de familia para la toma de decisiones. Juntos habitan una vivienda de material noble el cual  alquilan momentáneamente. Hace 8 años impulsada por el deseo de aportar a la economía familiar, salió a buscar una oportunidad laboral en las inmediaciones del paradero interprovincial de su localidad. Desde entonces madruga todos los días ofreciendo a sus comensales un desayuno nutritivo a base de maca y quinua acompañado de los deliciosos sándwich que ella misma prepara. Edgar quien labora en el rubro de transporte la lleva hasta su puesto muy temprano siéndole de gran ayuda.
Viajeros y conductores matutinos  están en su lista de clientes constantes ya que gracias a su carisma y buena atención ha logrado convertir su pequeño negocio en una buena fuente de ingreso. No obstante considera que madrugar todos los días la termina agotando en muchas ocasiones. 
Actualmente viene recibiendo propuestas por parte de pequeñas entidades quienes conocedores de su buena sazón en la preparación de sándwich  le han realizado varios pedidos para eventos y reuniones el cual requiere contar con ingredientes al por mayor para lograr abastecerse y cumplir satisfactoriamente ya que este tipo de oportunidades terminan generándole buenas ganancias. 
A futuro tiene planeado aperturar una tienda dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir que desea desempeñar paralelo a su negocio. Lleva consigo 4 préstamos con MFP con el cual a logrado cumplir puntualmente con todas sus pagos mensuales, asimismo manifiesta que le agrada trabajar con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que son personas muy sociables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes y tener capital de respaldo en adelante.
texts.en:
Norma, 38, has just one goal in life that all her efforts and sacrifice are focused on: her family.  Her spouse, Edgar, the father of her three children, Jordi, Kevin and Yoselin, has always been the motor and head of household for making decisions.  They live together in a house build of substantial materials that they are currently renting.  

Wishing to contribute to household expenses, she went out looking for an employment opportunity near the local transportation hub 8 years ago.  Since then, she rises at dawn every day to sell food to her diners, a nutritious breakfast based on maca root and quinoa accompanied by delicious sandwiches she makes herself.  Edgar works in transportation and takes her to work very early which is of great help to her.

Several drivers and morning travelers are on her list of regular customers because thanks to her charisma and good service she’s succeeded in turning her small business into a good source of income.  Nevertheless, she feels that rising at dawn every day causes her to be exhausted on many occasions.

Because of her tasty dishes, several firms that are aware of the way she makes her sandwiches have been approaching her and have placed several orders for events and meetings and she wants to buy ingredients at wholesale to have on hand to fill these customer orders and to have backup capital ahead of time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has been in active farming for three consecutive years in his rural home. He lives with his family of three children aged between 12 and 4 years. His produce includes maize, beans, eggs, vegetables and bananas. He runs a butchery business in the local market for additional income.

Evans has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a dairy cow. He mentions lack of ready, local markets and rampant price fluctuations as the major challenges of his farming business. 

His plans are to begin a cereals processing business. He says he meets the needs of his family, especially education of the children, through farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha, es una humilde comerciante, de 38 años de edad, originaria de  León, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 4 aún viven con ella ninguno estudia por todos ellos le ayudan a su padre a vender raspados mientras Martha se dedica a vender tortillas de maíz. Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre quien le enseño a hacer tortillas, fue lo único que aprendió pues solo finalizo la primaria su familia no tenía recursos económicos para darle más estudios. Su vivienda es muy humilde pero su familia muy trabajadora ella anhela mejorar su nivel de vida, tener la capacidad de poner  a todos sus en la escuela brindarles una mejor educación que ella no puedo tener.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar maíz, cal y leña para hacer tortilla pues necesita materia prima para trabajar y poder vender más. Poco a poco quiere  mejorar las condiciones de su casa y negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a humble merchant.  She is 38 years old and originally from León.  She is the mother of five children, four of whom still live with her.  None of her children attends school because all of them work selling snowcones (shaved ice) with their father while Martha works selling corn tortillas.  She learned this trade from her mother, who taught her to make tortillas.  She was the only one who learned how to.  Martha only completed school through the primary level because her family did not have the financial resources to send Martha to school for longer.  

Martha's home is very simple but her family is very hardworking.  She longs to improve her family's standard of living and to enroll all of her children in school so that they can have the education she was not able to have.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, lime and firewood to make tortillas.  She needs raw materials to be able to produce and sell in greater volume.  Little by little she wants to improve her home and business.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Winifreda

texts.en:
This is Winefreda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household as well as business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain both her daily needs and  the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Winifreda hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies with her group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear clothing and other merchandise to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Zamirakhon

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Замирахон.  Ей 36  лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Более 11  лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее 5  коровы. Она продает молоко своим соседям. Еще она продает скот, за которым она присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для покупки 2 коровы, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A person with a heart full of kindness and a wonderful soul, who lives among tall Tajik mountains, is in need of your support, as she has recently had problems with her finances.  Her name is Zamirakhon.  She is 36 years old, is married and is raising 6 children.  She has been raising livestock for more than 11 years.  She has 5 cows.  She sells milk to her neighbors.  She also sells livestock, which she raises for several months.  She would like to expand her business but does not have enough resources to do this.  She is asking for a loan of 1,100 US dollars for the purchase of 2 cows in order to grow her business.  She plans to use her income to provide her children with a good education and with modern technology.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows to grow her business

loans.name: Khandsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Khandsuren is 39 years old and lives with her family in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Mrs. Khandsuren has two children, a girl and a boy, aged 19 years old and 15 years old. During the day, Mrs. Khandsuren runs a clothes business at a local market called Narantuul. She purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 1999. Mrs. Khandsuren has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I have been planning to build a warehouse for my business and my family in the future. In addition, I would like to provide a good education for my children." Her husband has a tailoring business in his home town. Mrs. Khandsuren’s husband sews jackets and short coats. She sells these products at the market in Narantuul. She is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount material to sew jackets and short coats.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount material to sew jackets and short coats

loans.name: Manantial En  El Desierto Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros  socias emprendedoras María Auxiliadora tiene una pulpería anteriormente inicio su negocio echando tortillas en su casa y poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta iniciar su pulpería en su domicilio, el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, además quiere diversificar sus productos como compra de cosméticos, ropa, calzados etc., Carmen María tiene un pequeño kiosco donde vende comida rápida, hogdog, pizza, refrescos naturales, ubicado en un mercado de la capital, Lucia del Carmen vende nacatamales y destaza cerdos, Fátima Arelis tiene un pequeño taller de costura y además realiza recorrido  de transportes a estudiantes de primarias.
texts.en:
This group consists of four enterprising members. María Auxiliadora has a convenience store. She previously had a business making tortillas at home. Over time, she built up her savings until she had enough money to open a convenience store in her home. Her loan will be used to buy basic grains such as rice, as well as oil, beans, and sugar. She also wants to diversify her products by purchasing cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Carmen María has a small kiosk at a market located in the capital where she sells fast food, hot dogs, pizza, and natural soft drinks. • Lucia del Carmen sells Nicaraguan tamales and butchered pigs. • Fátima Arelis has a small sewing workshop, but she also provides transportation services to elementary school students.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, laundry soap, bath soap, and other products.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза с детства занималась приготовлением салата для родных и близких. Ей 32 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. После переезда на свой недостроенный участок  с мужем у неё начались трудности, надо было, достроить не законченный дом, создать условия для детей. Супруг Наргизы подрабатывает на стройке в  Федерации России, но этот доход не хватает на семью. Наргиза стремительная женщина. Наргиза  имеет опыта по приготовлением разных салатов по корейском и европейском рецептам. Уже 4 года, как она занимается изготовлением и продажей салатов. Она обращается в ИМОН Интернешнл в третий  раз с целью получение займа для покупки стройматериалов, чтобы достроить свой дом. Она уверена в себе, что  займ будет погашать от полученного дохода бизнеса.
texts.en: Since childhood, Nargiza has been making salads for her relatives.  She is 32 years old.  She is married and is raising 3 children.  After moving to her unfinished property with her husband she started having difficulties; they needed to finish the unfinished house and create good living conditions for the children.  Nargiza's spouse is working at a building site in the Russian Federation, but this income is not enough for the family.  Nargiza is a determined woman.  Nagiza has experience in cooking different types of salads using Korean and European recipes.  She has been making and selling salads for 4 years now.  She is turning to IMON International for the third time with the goal of getting a loan to purchase building materials to complete her house.  She is confident that she will pay back the loan using the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete house

loans.name: Geisel Maria

texts.es:
Geisel, habitante de la ciudad de León, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 12 años de edad, el mayor está estudiando la universidad y el menor está cursando la secundaria. Empezó su negocio hace 1 año con apoyo económico de su ex marido, compro un estante, una jarra de caramelos, galletas, chicles esos fueron sus primeros productos. Poco a poco fue creciendo su venta y de igual manera fue agregando más productos hasta formar su pulpería con la cual mantiene a su familia. 
Está requiriendo un crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, sopas, gaseosas, jugos, productos lácteos, avenas, enlatados, pollo, pasta de dientes.  Pues son los productos que más le solicitan y de los cuales necesita tener en inventario . Su sueño es convertir su pequeña pulpería en una miscelánea donde ofrezca variedad de productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Geisel is an inhabitant of the city of León and is a single mother. She has two children who are 21 and 12 years old. The oldest is at university and the younger is in secondary school. She began her business a year ago with economic support from her ex husband. She bought a shelf, a candy jar, cookies and gum. These were her first products. Little by little she increased her sales and at the same time added more products to form the store that takes care of her family.

She needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soups, soda, juices, dairy products, oats, canned goods, chicken and toothpaste. They are the products that are in highest demand and of which she needs to have stocked. Her dream is to convert her small store into a variety store where she can offer a variety of products for the home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soups, soda, juices, dairy products, oats, canned goods, chicken and toothpaste.

loans.name: Hebe Zoika

texts.es: Hebe es una joven de 19 años de edad   que trabaja y estudia. Actualmente cursa el 4to ciclo de  la carrera de diseño gráfico. Decidió  estudiar dicha carrera, pues de muy niña le gustaba dibujar y era buena para ello. Los fines de semana labora en un restaurante, esto le ayuda a  cubrir sus gastos de  pasajes y materiales que le piden en su universidad. Agradece a sus padres, pues ellos son quienes le apoyan con su educación. El dinero que solicito lo destinara para el pago de pensiones de la universidad. Ser una egresada profesional competitiva es su mayor deseo, pues al culminar sus estudios  buscara trabajo en una empresa prestigiosa. Hebe esta agradecida con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en: Hebe, 19, works and studies.  She’s currently in the 4th graphic design term.  She decided to study this career because she’s liked to draw since she was a little girl and she was good at it.  On weekends she works in a restaurant to help cover her transportation and school supplies costs for the university.  She’s grateful to her parents because they help pay for her education.  The money she’s requesting will be used to pay tuition.  Her greatest wish is to graduate as a competitive professional because when she completes her studies she will look for employment in a prestigious firm.  Hebe is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es: Gina tiene 51 años de edad está casada su esposo es militar jubilado de las fuerzas Armadas. Tiene hijos mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Gina  comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró y a raíz de que su esposo se jubilo  tuvo que luchar para llevar el pan de cada día  a su hogar es por eso que Gina  desde ese entonces decidió vender cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien. En la actualidad trabaja en las tardes ofreciendo a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc. Su sueño es distribuir sus productos por toda la costa ecuatoriana.
texts.en: Gina, 51, is married and her husband is retired from the armed forces.  She has adult children who are independent.  Gina started this activity because of the lack of employment opportunities in the country and she wanted to find a job but was unable to.  Since her husband’s retirement she’s had to struggle daily to provide daily bread for her home and this is why Gina decided since then to sell cosmetics and has done very well.  She currently works afternoons selling the products she has to her neighbors.  She wants to use the loan to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorant, talc, etc.  Her dream is to sell her products along the entire Ecuadorean coast.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cologne and creams.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
The desire for self-improvement is one of Wakati’s most important dreams. She lives with her family in her own house in the coastal region of Kenya. 
She has a sewing workshop where she makes all types of clothes: shirts, dresses, skirts and blouses, among other things. She’s been in business for some time now and is very well-known in the area.  She sells from home and has many customers who prefer her for the quality of her products, her affordable prices, and above all the excellent service. She’s an active, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals to reach. She’s working hard to attain a more prosperous future. She feels happy with her business, because she knows she must work in order to rise out of poverty.

Demand has increased in recent weeks so she wants to make a new investment and buy raw materials needed to make the clothes which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy fabric at wholesale, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials at wholesale: fabric, thread, zippers, etc., to make clothes.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 33 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She resides in the District of Kwale in the town of Tiribe.
She saw the need of having a vegetable stall in her neighborhood. This is why she wants to open one. 

In order to obtain operating capital, she decided to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 KES for a start. The money will be invested in the purchase of tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbages, etc. Her plans for the future are to make improvements to her home and to continue supporting her children who are in school.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbages, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es: Roció tiene 44 años de edad vive en  un sector de Guayaquil llamado Orquídeas está casada,su esposo es albañil, tiene hijos mayores de edad por lo que no viven con ellas y cada hijo tiene  su propio hogar. Su esposo le puso un puesto de venta de comida. Roció vende en la actualidad ceviches, bollos. Ella trabaja sola desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Rocio es quien realiza la venta y preparación empezando a las 8 de la mañana con desayunos. Con el crédito quiere comprar verde, arroz,  pescado etc. Su sueño es tener una picantería muy reconocida en Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Rocío, 44, lives in a sector of Guayaquil called Orquídeas.  She’s married and her husband works in construction. She has adult children that don’t live with her; each of her children has their own home.

Her husband set up a food stand for her.  She currently sells ceviche [marinated seafood cocktail] and ‘bollos’ [fish-filled fried plantain balls].  She works alone from 5am until 4pm.  Rocío does both the food preparation and the selling starting with breakfast at 8am.  She wants to use the loan to buy plantain, rice, fish, etc.  Her dream is to have a very well-known snack bar in Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy plantain, rice, fish, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 45 años es una mujer alegre. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellas: Lisbeth, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Paccha. Cultiva principalmente la papa, el maíz y también alfalfa para dar de alimentar a sus animales, tiene vacas, terneras y ovejas que con la ayuda de su hija llevan a pastear al campo cuando es escaso  la producción de alfalfa que generalmente en época de verano no se produce en cantidades suficientes y lo que llega a cosechar vende al mercado provincial de su localidad. También vende  de acuerdo a la ocasión sus animales como ovejas, vacas y toros; cuando se le presenta una oportunidad de venta, que por lo general acuden a su casa, considera que es bueno trabajar en estas dos actividades paralelas  para  mantener la estabilidad de los ingresos y crecer progresivamente. Pero como es muy trabajadora, también trabaja embolsando carne de pollo en una empresa, cuenta que lo hace de 2 a 3 veces a la semana, pues tiene que cuidar de sus animales  y producción. Ahora se ha trazado metas concretas para  seguir creciendo. Y está segura de lograrlo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable. Olga, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de medicinas para dosificar y calcificar a sus animales y si el dinero le alcanza podrá también comprar alfalfa para alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Olga is 45 years old and a cheerful woman. She has three children but only lives with one, Lisbeth. She lives in hre own house located in Paccha. She mainly grows potatoes and corn, as well as alfalfa to feed her animals. She has cows and sheep that she brings to pasture in the countryside with her daughter when the alfalfa production is scarce. Alfalfa production is generally not enough during the summer time and what she is able to harvest she sells in the main market of her town. She also sells her animals, including sheep, cows and bulls, when the opportunity presents itself. Her animals typically are kept near her home. 

She considers it good to have two types of activities running parallel to maintain income stability and progressively grow. Since she is such a hard worker, she also works packaging chicken for a company, doing so two to three times a week, as she also has to care for her animals and harvest. She has now traced concrete goals to continue growing and is certain she will achieve them. 

She belongs to the solidarity group "Productoras Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras" and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She is thankful for the financial support that has been brought to her in a constant manner. She now has the means to improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her loans since the organization has already taught her to be responsible. Olga will invest the money requested to buy medicines for her animals and also to buy alfalfa to feed her animals if there is enough money left over.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her animals and alfalfa as pasture.

loans.name: Yver

texts.es: El señor Yver es una persona trabajadora comentan sus compañeros de trabajo, actualmente es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con su madre y sus hermano el ayuda con la comida en su casa, ellos no viven con su  padre él es el hermano mayor de sus 3 hermanitos los cuales están en colegio, él se levanta a muy tempranas horas por las mañanas para hacer el desayuno a sus hermanitos y mandarlos al colegio, su madre se va a muy tempranas horas a trabajar en el chaco, una vez que envía a sus hermanitos al colegio él se dedica a trabajar con su motocicleta en el sector de moto taxis hasta medio día para luego el ir a cocinar para cuando lleguen sus hermano, día a día su trabajo es el de educar y que no les falte nada a sus hermanos, en la actualidad su motocicleta esta con algunos desperfectos es por eso que él necesita un crédito para renovar su motocicleta y así poder trabajar como lo hace hasta el día de hoy.
texts.en:
According to his co-workers, Sr. Yver is a hardworking individual. He is currently single and has no children. Yver lives with his mother and siblings, so he must help with the food costs at home. His father does not live with them. Yver is the oldest child and has three younger siblings who are in school. He wakes up in the early morning hours so that he can prepare breakfast for his siblings before sending them off to school. During this time, his mother begins her work in the fields.

Once his siblings leave for school, Yver begins providing motorcycle taxi services and continues to work until noon. At that time, he begins preparing lunch for when his siblings return from school. Every day, Yver works so that he can provide his siblings an education since he was not able to finish school.

At the moment, his motorcycle is experiencing a few problems, so he needs a loan so that he can handle the repairs. This will help him continue in the work that he has performed to this day.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Saturdaymar

texts.en:
Saturdaymar, 40, is a married mother of four children, and resides with her family in Buchanan.  Her children are between
the ages of 9 and 19, and are in school. 

She has been selling palm oil in the market for the past ten years.  She makes a profit when she sells, because she sells good palm oil.   She learned to sell from her mother.  She uses the profit to buy more palm oil, and attend to her family's needs. She has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil for the business. 

Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for the business.

loans.name: God Is Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you members of the “God Is Bless” group. These small scale entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the third time to seek a new loan of 500,000 Leones for each in order to further improve their respective businesses. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. Fatmata is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children – 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Fatmata sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata is going to buy gara lapper making materials like white cotton cloths, inks, caustic soda, powder, etc., in order to produce a large quantity of gara lappers for sale.

loans.use: to buy gara lapper making materials like white cotton cloths, inks, caustic soda, powder, etc., in order to produce a large quantity of gara lappers for sale

loans.name: Altanbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Altanbayar is 44 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter in their wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her house is located in the boundary zone of the city, with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. Altanbayar's husband has physical challenges and receives 150 dollars per month from the government, as a disability pension. Her daughter studies at a secondary school. Her son has been working as a contract worker in Korea for several years, and every month he sends some money home for the family. 

In 2010 Altanbayar built a 240-square-meter house with her son’s money, and split it into ten rooms for rent to students, who come from countryside. She manages this house and provides cleaning every day. Altanbayar receives 1,000,000 MNT (100,000 MNT per room), but she pays half of the income for heating and electricity. She uses a coal burning stove to heat the rental house. From the past years' experiences, she realized that using the coal burning stove is inconvenient. It generates harmful chemicals to the atmosphere, and needs to have fuel added every six hours. So Altanbayar is requesting a loan to buy and install a low-pressure furnace, to heat the rental house and to cut the usage of coal. By doing this she will save the environment, and at the same time she can save some of the money she would have spent for heating.

loans.use: to buy and install a low-pressure furnace to heat the house that she rents out to students, in order to cut the usage of coal.

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from members of the "Hope Sisters" group from Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. Members of the "Hope Sisters" group are very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan they have just repaid. With the help of that loan, they were able to expand their respective businesses, made more sales and consequently improved their living conditions. Having repaid the loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan in order to further improve their businesses. Featured leader Fatu, will again use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, onions, etc., to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy food – salt, margi, onions, etc., at wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 49 es una mujer dichosa. Ella vive en compañía de Ceferino, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo cuida a 4 en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Usibamba. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre sale a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues es temporada y necesita de una buena cosecha. Sus principales cultivos constan de alfalfa, pastos, avena y demás alimentos para su ganado, pues se dedica a la crianza de vacas, ya cuenta con 8, de los cuales 3 están preñadas, por lo que no brindan leche; aunque ahora este algo escaso, sabe que no durará  para siempre, pues cuando ya nacen las terneras, sus vacas le proporcionarán buena leche y podrá vender a un buen precio. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a ella; es el tejido, mientras realiza sus actividades, ella elabora diversas prendas como chompas, tapetes, colchas y demás accesorios a base de lana. Ahí obtiene una ganancia extra y además disfruta de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable. Amelia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca lechera con la que piensa aumentar la cantidad de producción de leche.
texts.en:
Amelia, 49, is a fortunate woman.  She lives with Ceferino, her husband of 26 years.  They have five children four of which are still cared for at home located in Usibamba Annex.  She heads out every morning as usual to care for her crops because it’s the season and she needs good harvests.  Her main crops are alfalfa, grasses, oats and other cattle feed since she works raising cows; she currently owns 8, three of which are pregnant so produce no milk.  Even though milk is a bit scarce now she knows this won’t last forever because when the calves are born the cows will produce good milk and she’ll be able to sell it at a good price.

What she likes best, though, is knitting.  While doing her chores, she makes various items like sweaters, mats, bedspreads and other accessories out of wool thus earning extra income.  Besides, she enjoys this work.

She belongs to the “Usibamba” communal bank and this is the 6th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she’s constantly granted.  Now she has the means for improving her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because they taught her how to be responsible.  Amelia will use the requested money to buy a dairy cow she plans to use to increase the amount of milk produced.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fresia Editha

texts.es: Fresia vive en un sector de Guayaquil llamado la Orquídeas. Tiene 42 años de edad está divorciada, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que asiste a una escuela pública del sector. Ella  invirtió su dinero ahorrado en la comprar de un carro, por lo que ahora es conductora de un taxi. Fresia se levanta a trabajar a las  5 de la mañana y termina su jornada de trabajo a las 9 de la noche. Su meta es comprarse 2 carros mas y así poderle dar trabajo a personas que no lo tenga, y darle una mejor vida para su hijo. Con el préstamo Fresia comprara llantas, bocina para el auto etc.
texts.en:
Fresia lives in an area of Guayaquil called “las Orquídeas”.  She is 42 years old and is divorced.  She has one young son who attends a public school in the area.  She invested her saved money in the purchase of a car and now she is a taxi driver.  Fresia gets up to work at 5:00a.m. and finishes her workday at 9:00p.m.  

Her goal is to buy two more cars and thus be able to give work to people who don’t have it and to give her son a better life.  With the loan Fresia will buy tires and a horn for the car, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires and a horn for her car.

loans.name: Wendy Jomaira

texts.es: Wendy vive en el Norte de Guayaquil tiene 27 años de edad tiene 2 hijos. Hace 8 años empezó con el negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos por catálogos. La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos.  Wendy  por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar, artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc. Su sueño poder comprarse unas perchas y poder exhibir sus productos en su casa etc.
texts.en: Wendy lives in northern Guayaquil. She is 27 years old and has two children. Eight years ago she began her business selling cosmetics by catalog. Her way of working is to travel to various parts of the city selling her products to friends and acquaintances. Wendy for the time being has not had any problems with crime and hopes to continue in the same way. With the loan she plans to purchase beauty supplies such as lipstick, eye shadow, perfumes, creams, etc. Her dream is to be able to buy some racks in order to display her products at home etc.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies such as lipstick, eye shadow, perfume, creams, etc.

loans.name: Mirkosim

texts.ru: Миркосим мужчина в возрасте 39-лет.   Он женат имеет троих  детей.    Дети учиться в средней  школе.    Его жена работает в городском родильном доме, акушеркой.   Миркосим по специальности работает  плотником и этой деятельностью занимается   более 10 лет.   Он очень любит свою семью и хочет чтобы  в дальнейшем его дети жили в комфортных условиях.   Он начал строить дом но у него не хватает денежных средств.   Так как сейчас осень он хочет как можно быстрее купит необходимые строительные материалы для  покрытия крыши своего дома.   Все что он  и его жена зарабатывают не хватает для строительство дома и  поэтому он обратился в нашу организацию для получения кредита.   На полученный кредит Миркосим планирует купить строительные материалы.   Он  заранее благодарит   «Арванд»  за поддержку.
texts.en: Mirkosim is 39 years old and married with three children.  His children are in high school and his wife works as a midwife at the city maternity hospital.  Mirkosim works in construction, a profession he has held for more than ten years.  He loves his family very much and wants them to have good living conditions in the future.  He has begun to build a family home, but he does not have enough money to continue.  As it is autumn now, he wants to buy the necessary building materials to cover the roof as soon as possible.  The combined income of Mirkosim and his wife is not enough for the construction of their home, which is why he has turned to our organization to apply for a loan.  On receiving the loan, Mirkosim plans to buy building materials.  He thanks "Arvand" in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Davaajargal

texts.en:
Mr. Davaajargal is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife, Byambajargal, is retired and stays at home. His daughter Dolgorsuren, age 26, and son Guyenbaatar, age 23, stay at home helping their father's business. His youngest son goes to the secondary school. 

His young son Mongondavaa, age 17, has just entered university. 

Mr. Davaajargal has been operating a small, traditional food cafe, since 2010. In addition, he has just opened a grocery store. He is planning to expand his business and let his children become educated and able to live by themselves. He is now requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to cover his young son's university expenses, including tuition and dormitory. Davaajargal is an ethical and punctual man, recognized as such by local customers and clients.

loans.use: To cover his young son's university expenses

loans.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs.Erdene-Oyun lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in the Songinokhairkhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Erdenebat is a taxi driver, while her daughter is a primary school student.

Erdene-Oyun has been working at a private tailoring company for the last three years. Having thus acquired good experience, she is now starting to work at home. In near future, however, she wants to have her own workplace and eventually buy a new car. She is therefore requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase raw materials and equipment for her newly-starting business. A calm and friendly woman, Erdene-Oyun says, "I will pay my loan as fast as I can without delinquency".

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and equipment for her newly-starting business.

loans.name: Alvaro Fabricio

texts.es: Álvaro  tiene 28 años de edad está casado tiene 1 hija de 1 año de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa. Álvaro empezó con su negocio al no encontar trabajo realizando fletes. El carro era de su padre quien se lo habia comprado hace años. Álvaro sale a trabajar de lunes a sábado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. El trabajo lo hace solo y su mayor preocupación es cuando su vehículo se le daña. Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas y arreglar su carro etc. Su meta es ponerse un comercial de venta de repuesto de carros.
texts.en: Álvaro, 28, is married and has a one-year-old daughter.  His wife’s a housewife.  Álvaro started his hauling and delivery business when he was unable to secure employment.  The vehicle was his father’s; he’d bought it years ago.  Álvaro heads out to work Monday through Saturday at 6 in the morning and works until 10 at night.  He works alone and his greatest worry is when his vehicle is breaks down.  He wants to use the loan to buy tires, repair the vehicle, etc.  His goal is to open a vehicle spare parts store.

loans.use: coto buy tires and to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Khairi

texts.en:
Khairi is 57 years old and from Tulkarem. He is married and has two children. He has owned a taxi since 2009.

Khairi asked Ryada for this loan in order to do maintenance for his car like repairing the motor, buying new brakes, and maintaining the car overall.

He hopes that this loan will help him repair his taxi and improve his income.

loans.use: to do maintenance for his car like repairing the motor, buying new brakes, and maintaining the car overall.

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulmaa, age 48, lives with her family in a residential district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband is named Jargalsaihan, age 52. Her daughter Odonchimeg, age 21, is a third-year university student. 

Mrs. Dulmaa started her clothing retail business at a local market in 2008. She is an honest and modest woman, who has gained a lot of cutomers' trust over the years. She also has good taste in clothes, so customers like to shop at her retail counter. Mrs. Dulmaa is planning to expand her business and open her own store, in her own workplace, in the near future.

She is now requesting a 3,800,000 MNT loan to pay her daughter's university tuition, and other expenses related to her education.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's university tuition, and other expenses related to her education

loans.name: Nery Donatila

texts.es: Nery viven en  el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Está casada tiene hijos mayores de edad que son independientes. Nery comenzó hace 5 años atrás en ponerse una tienda por su sector ya que vio la necesidad de sus vecinos por lo que no había ninguna por su sector. Ella comenzó vendiendo atún, aceite, colas. El sueño de Nery es tener un mini market . Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar viveres en general como  aceite, azúcar, arroz, etc.
texts.en: Nery lives in El Suburbio in Guayaquil. She’s married and has adult children who are independent.  Nery opened a store in her neighborhood five years ago when she noticed the need her neighbors had since there was none nearby in her sector.  She started selling tuna, oil and soft-drinks.  Nery’s dream is to own a mini-mart.  She wants to use the loan to buy foodstuffs in general like oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Juan Gualberto

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad La Libertad de la provincia  de Santa Elena. Esta  divorciado de su esposa,  tiene hijos mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Juan es comerciante el vende todo lo referente a ropa. El comenzó a trabajar en este negocio porque le fue heredado ya que sus padres fueron quienes comenzaron con el negocio y de ahí el aprendió. En la actualidad el se ha independizado y recorre las ciudades para vender su mercadería. Con el préstamo va a comprar blusas, camisas, shorts, etc. Su sueño es tener un almacén de venta de ropa  para no tener que viajar
texts.en: Juan, 53, lives in the city of La Libertad, Santa Elena Province.  He’s divorced from his wife.  He has adult children who are independent.  Juan’s a merchant selling all types of clothes.  He started in this business because he inherited from his parents who started it and he learned there.  He’s currently working independently and goes to various cities to sell his merchandise.  He will use the loan to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, etc.  His dream is to have a clothing store in order not to have to travel from place to place any longer.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 38, resides with her husband at Buchanan. She has two children, ages 5 and 12, who are attending school. 

She has been involved in the sales of lappa (country cloth) for the past six years. She learned to sell from her friend, and received help from her husband to start in this business. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods and contributes to the home. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more lappa for her business, and hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (country cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Gajmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Gajmaa is 57 years old, and lives with her husband in the Songinokhairkhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her children are married and have moved out of her house. She is retired. Her husband Dorjoo is taxi driver. Mrs.Gajmaa started her business of coal and firewood retail in 2010. She is well-experienced in this sector and she has many regular customers. She also plants and harvests organic vegetables in her greenhouse. She is planning to plant more next year and she needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase vegetable seeds and soil in order to boost her plantation and volume of harvest. She is an honest and modest person.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and soil in order to boost her plantation and volume of harvest

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet, de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive en compañía de William, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Usibamba. El trabajo continuo es su lema. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano prepara los alimentos que venderá en la escuela de su localidad. Donde hace 2 años abrió un pequeño negocio, en el cual vende golosinas, bebidas y comida casera a los alumnos y profesores que cada refrigerio visitan a Yanet. Cuenta que fue difícil para ella obtener el permiso para vender dentro de la institución, “pero nada es difícil si eres constante”, afirma. Al mismo tiempo y como mujer del campo; se dedica a la siembra de avena y crianza de vacas. Siembra en terrenos de su comunidad todos los fines de semana y realiza yogurt y queso con la leche de sus vacas. Pero la actividad que le trae más ganancias es la venta de helados y chupetes los días de feria de su zona, donde ella obtiene buenas ganancias. Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco en todas las actividades que desarrolla, pues es ahí donde se siente realizada. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Yanet, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más helados para vender en la feria, y su el dinero le alcanza comprará golosinas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yanet, 27, is a hardworking woman. She lives with William, her husband of 10 years.  They have three children, Estefanía, Josué and Jean Carlos, who she cares for in her own house located in Usibamba.  Her motto is constant work.  She prepares the food she’ll sell at her local school very early in the morning.  She opened a small business there two years ago selling snacks, soft-drinks and home-made food to students and teachers who visit Yanet during recess.  She says that it was difficult for her to get permission to sell inside the school but “nothing’s difficult is you stick with it,” she affirms.

At the same time, being a woman from the countryside, she also grows oats and raises cows.  She plants on communal land every weekend and makes yoghurt and cheese with milk from her cows.  But the activity that is most profitable is selling ice-cream and frozen pops during her local market days; she earns good profits then.

She now wants to work with more dedication in all of her activities because that’s how she feels fulfilled.  She belongs to the “Usibamba” communal bank and this is her 6th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she’s constantly being granted because now she has the means to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments since she’s been taught to be responsible.  Yanet will use the requested money to buy more frozen treats to sell during market day and if the money goes far enough she will also buy snacks for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ice-cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds and dairy goats.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Ms Sajida is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of stitching for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and has become famous in her community. Her husband is employed in a small factory. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. This compelled her to start her business to contribute to the family income.  Sajida is a mother of five: three daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. However, these days she is facing problems in completing orders on time due to a shortage of raw material. For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKRs to buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zips for embellishments. She is hopeful to earn more by serving more customers consistently. She desires to utilize part of the profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zips for embellishments.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38-year-old man. He is married to Felista and together they have four children. He operates a butcher shop and has been in the business for the past six years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan successfully and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of meat for resale in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to make more profits so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of meat to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 32 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edson con quien tiene 3 hijos: Kevin, Cristian y Joseph, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 3 años. La mayor pasión de su esposo es el baile, sobre todo las danzas típicas de todas las regiones del país. Fue entonces que junto a él decidieron convertir esta pasión en un medio para salir adelante, desde entonces pasaron 14 años dedicando su tiempo y esfuerzo en enseñar a diversas instituciones, estudiantes y demás personas danzas costumbristas; con el tiempo adicionó a sus enseñanzas los trajes típicos de cada una de ellas. Norma se dedica a confeccionar cuidar y limpiar los disfraces que día a día su esposo alquila como un adicional a su enseñanza, obtiene buenos ingresos semanales, sobre todo en las fechas festivas o cualquier evento de este tipo en la ciudad. Ahora se encuentran diseñando los disfraces para el baile “solteritos de jauja”, además de disfraces con materiales reciclables, pues es más económico y ayudan con mantener el planeta. “En estos tiempos todas los colegios lo piden”, afirma. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Norma, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 36 disfraces del baile típico de “solteritos”, ya tiene el pedido de estos disfraces y quiere cumplir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma, 32, is a simple woman. She lives in the company of her husband Edson with whom she has three children: Kevin, Cristian and Joseph, whom she cares for in a rental home where they have lived for three years. Her husband's greatest passion is dance, above all the traditional dances from all the country's regions. Thus they together decided to turn this passion into a means of getting ahead. Since then they have have spent 14 years dedicating their time and effort to teaching various institutions, students and other persons the local dance customs. In time they added to their teachings the traditional costumes to go along with each one. Norma spends her time sewing, caring for and cleaning the costumes that her husband rents day by day as a side business to their teaching. They make good weekly earnings and especially on holidays or any event of this kind in the city. Now they are busy designing costumes for the "single men of Jauja" dance as well as costumes made from recyclable materials since it is more economical and helps maintain the planet. "These days all the schools are asking for it," she states. 

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she appreciates the financial support they have continually granted her. Now she has the means to improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her payments since she was taught to be responsible. Norma will invest the money in the purchase of 36 costumes for the traditional "single men" dance. She has already received the order for these costumes and wants to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 36 traditional dance costumes for single male dancers, which have already been ordered, in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 45-year-old, vigorous married woman. She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for the past two years. 

She beautifully makes patterns and becomes famous in her community.  She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong, but the business challenges, combined with the family expenditures she faces, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store. He earns not enough to support his family well, while Safia is the best earning resource of her house, as her embroidery patterns are very popular in her street.

Safia is a mother of three children; all are school-going. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw material such as reels of thread, packs of sequins, and pearls in large quantity to meet with the increasing demand.  

She shared her dreams of running a training center for girls of her village to train them and to transfer her skills, so that they can help her in expanding her business and also earn for them.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as reels of thread, packs of sequins, and pearls in large quantity to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: William  Leonardo

texts.es: William tiene 30 de edad vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Está casado tiene 2 hijos el mayor de 10 años y el menor de 8 años los 2 asisten a una escuela pública  de sector. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos. William comenzó ya hace 12 años atrás con la elaboración de perfumes caseros ya que fue su tío que le enseño este trabajo.
