She will use the loan to buy more cheeses and sausages as that is what sells the most. She would like to have a small business and have workers so that she can support them with stable work.

loans.use: to buy more cheeses and sausages.

loans.name: Rocio Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. rocío de 48 años es separada  es una Sra. muy trabajadora ya que tiene 1 año 6 meses laborando en una de las maquiladoras de la comunidad, la Sra. rocío ha realizado mejoras año con año a su vivienda para en un futuro dejarle un buen patrimonio a su hija.
Ya que se preocupa por su pequeña  en esta ocasión solicita el apoyo de esta institución para terminar la barda de su casa y así poder estar un poco mas segura y así Será mas difícil que alguien pueda entrar a su hogar estaría muy agradecida de contar con la ayuda.
texts.en:
Rocío, 48, is separated.  She's a very hardworking woman because she has been working for a year and a half in one of the maquiladoras in town.  She has been making improvements on her house every year so she can leave her daughter a good inheritance in the future.

She's worried about her little girl, so she's requesting support from this institution to finish the fence for her house.  This way she'll be a bit more secure and it'll be difficult for someone to break into her home.  She would be very grateful to have the help.

loans.use: to finish the fence for her house

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas. Este  Dúo  está integrado por la señora María Guadalupe de 62 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 13 años, le da gracias a Dios por darle la oportunidad de tener su negocito, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles está contenta por tener la oportunidad de un crédito ya que de esta forma poco a poco ira creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres Accionistas [Women's Shareholders Duo] 

Sixty-two year old María Guadalupe is a partner in this Duo. She earns a living selling foodstuffs for daily consumption. She has engaged in this activity for 13 years now. She gives thanks to God for giving her the opportunity to have her small business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy foodstuffs. She is happy to have the opportunity to take out a loan because, this way, little by little, her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora angélica tiene la edad de 52 años es casada es originaria de torreón y actualmente vive en esta ciudad ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual tiene una antigüedad de 11 años la tienda de abarrotes la tiene en su hogar es una Sra. muy trabajadora  trata de ayudarle a los gastos a su esposo de la casa en esta ocasión esta solicitando este préstamo para la colocación de Vitropiso en su hogar y así que se vea mas linda su casa estaría muy agradecida con su apoyo.
texts.en: Angélica, 52, is married and is originally from Torreón; she currently lives in this city.  She has a small grocery store that’s been in operation for 11 years.  She has it installed at home.  She’s a very hardworking woman and tries to help her husband cover household expenses.  On this occasion she’s asking for this loan to install tile flooring at home so that the house will look prettier.  She would be very grateful for your help.

loans.use: to install tile flooring.

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es: Mayra, de oficio comerciante, originaria de León, dueña de una pequeño Kiosco donde vende snacks, galletas, jugos, recargas telefónicas, aguas embotelladas. Ella dice que gracias al primer crédito KIVA logro surtir de productos su Kiosco sus ventas mejoraron ahora desea seguir agregando más productos nuevos que capte la atención de sus clientes y lo haga un kiosco diferentes de los demás. Por eso está requiriendo este crédito para comprar productos de limpieza como detergentes, jabones, papel higiénico, jugos, pan, café, leche, platos, vasos, cucharas descartables. Siempre manteniendo la meta de poner otro kiosco y agregarle mejores y nuevos productos
texts.en:
Mayra, a merchant by trade, originally from León, is the owner of a small kiosk where she sells snacks, cookies, juice, phone recharges, and bottled water. 

She says that thanks to her first Kiva loan, she was able to stock her kiosk with products and her sales improved. Now she wishes to continue adding more new products that capture the attention of her customers and make her kiosk different from the others. 

Therefore she requires this loan in order to buy cleaning products like detergents and soaps, as well as toilet paper, juices, bread, coffee, milk, plates, glasses, and disposable spoons. 

She will always keep the goal of putting up another kiosk and adding better and new products to it.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products like detergents and soaps, as well as toilet paper, juices, bread, coffee, milk, plates, glasses, and disposable spoons

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Con 58 años Marcelina, es madre de 3 hijos y esposa de Obdulio. Ella muy comprometida con su familia logró hacer realidad su casa costándole  muchos años de trabajo. Dedicada al negocio de venta de ropa en distintos puntos de la zona, pues ella desempeña su labor nuevamente, debido a que tuvo problemas con su salud que la obligaron a quedar en reposo durante mas de 5 meses. Actualmente trabaja mucho para lograr ayudar en el sustento ecónomico a su familia. 
Pero al ver que sus ventas tienen buena acogida, eso la incentiva a incursionar en la venda de calzados y es por pedido de sus clientes, cuyas sugerencias siempre le han funcionado. Tiene planeado realizar la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor dentro de las cuales están muy solicitadas los polos y las blusas no dejando de lado el buen gusto que posee para complacer a sus compradores. Su décimo crédito la motiva a seguir trabajando y también rescatar uno de sus valores preferidos que es la puntualidad. Con los 2,000 soles comprará prendas al por mayor consistente en polos y blusas así como shorts y bermudas.
texts.en:
At the age of 58, Marcelina is the mother of three children and wife of Obdulio.  She’s very committed to her family and with many years of hard work succeeded in building her house.  She sells clothes in various parts of the zone.  She’s started to work again because she had some health problems that forced her to rest for more than five months.  She currently works hard to help support her family economically.

However, seeing that her sales are being well-received, she’s motivated to start selling shoes; her customers are requesting them and their suggestions have always worked.  She plans to buy clothes at wholesale.  Among the most requested items are shirts and blouses and she has very good taste to satisfy her buyers.

Her tenth loan motivates her to continue working and renew one of favorite values: punctuality.  She will use the 2,000 soles to buy shirts, blouses, shorts and Bermuda shorts at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, shorts and Bermua shorts.

loans.name: Llanelis Nohemi

texts.es: Llanelis, casada, originaria de León, estudiante de la carrera de Farmacia, se dedica a la crianza y  venta de cerdos. Gracias al crédito Kiva ha tenido la oportunidad de crear un record crediticio limpio tiene más clientes, ha podido pagar sus estudios y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente visita otras zona para vender ha conseguido más clientes  y necesita vender más  es por tal motivo que está solicitando el crédito para comprar cerdos de desarrollo y comprar concentrados para alimentarlos. Siempre sigue su sueño de lograr finalizar su carrera y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Llanelis is married and is originally from León.  She is studying to be a pharmacist, and in the meantime she is raising and selling pigs.  Thanks to credit through Kiva, she has had the opportunity to build a good credit record and to gain more customers.  She has been able to pay for her studies and help with the household expenses. Currently she is travelling to other areas in order to sell her animals, and in this way she has expanded her client base.  She needs to make more sales, and for this reason she is seeking a loan in order to buy pigs to raise and food so she can feed them.

She will keep pursuing her dream to finish her studies and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman of twenty five years; she sells beauty products.  She has been in this business for three years, and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand.

This will be Alice's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy beauty products such as hair oil, facial scrub, and hair chemicals for sale. 

In future she wants to get married, have children, and also become a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: To buy new beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 44 años, es una mujer empeñosa que a lado de Alejandro su pareja desempeñan una excelente labor de padres, pues la vida les ha regalado 4 hijos quienes en su totalidad desempeñan estudios superiores gracias al gran apoyo incondicional que reciben. Posee una vivienda de madera cuyo objetivo a futuro es construirla de material noble. Desempeña desde hace 20 años la actividad productiva de cacao cuyos años de experiencia le han valido para consolidar sus parcelas como una buena fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia. Alejandro quien es el gran apoyo que siempre tuvo se encarga de las laboras mas complicadas.
Una de sus actividades preferidas es la extracción de cacao porque lo considera  entretenido, no obstante el proceso que requiere mas paciencia es el secado ya que de ello dependerá la calidad final para la venta.
Finalizada la época de cosecha ella  necesita invertir nuevamente en el mantenimiento de sus parcelas para así garantizar una optima producción dentro de las cuales esta el deshierbo, sembrado de almácigos, implantación de injertos y el abono adecuado con productos orgánicos.
Dentro de sus planes a futuro es desempeñarse también en la venta de ropa debido a existir temporadas en el año en el que el trabajo de campo escasea, de esta manera seguir aportando al creamiento de su economía familiar. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contenta por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal.
Con los 500  soles complementará su capital para la compra de almácigos de cacao así como abono orgánico indispensable para optimizar su producción.
texts.en:
Teodora, 44, is a dedicated woman who alongside her spouse, Alejandro, carry out the excellent job of parenting because life has blessed them with four children who are all attending higher education thanks to the unconditional support they receive.  She has a wood house that she hopes in future to build with substantial materials.  She’s been growing cocoa beans for 20 years and her experience has made it possible for her to turn her parcels into a good source of income for her and her family.  Alejandro, who is the greatest support she’s ever had, does the more complicated chores.

One of her favorite activities is extracting the cocoa because it keeps her busy notwithstanding that the process that requires the most patience is drying because that’s what quality for sales depends on.

Once harvesting is over, she needs to invest again to provide maintenance to her fields to guarantee optimal crop yields.  Among the tasks are weeding, transplanting seedlings, implanting grafts and adequately fertilizing with organic manure.

Among her future plans is to start selling clothes because there are seasons during the year when work decreases and she can continue contributing to family economy this way.  This is her 4th MFP loan and the money will be very beneficial for her work’s development.  She feels happy to belong to the group of members in her communal bank.  She will use the 500 soles to add to her capital to buy seedlings to transplant as well as organic manure that’s essential to optimize production.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure.

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en:
Ms. Shumila is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers various goods of daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list.

Shumila's husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income alone to support his family.  She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family.

As Shumila wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Shumila wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Centro De Salud Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de compañeros de trabajo y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Centro de Salud de Urubamba” en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba. Ya son seis meses que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios son profesionales de la salud como enfermeras, auxiliares y doctores todos estos profesionales trabajan en una entidad de salud en la ciudad de Urubamba. 

La socia Flor Maria nació en la ciudad Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba es decir donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada entonces fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella es cirujano dentista y ya son 14 años que ejerce su profesión y le va muy bien, ella trabaja como dentista en un centro de salud pero en sus horas libres se dedica a su profesión de forma independiente donde hace curaciones de dientes, profilaxis, extracciones entre otras cosas más.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como amalgama, resina y otras cosas más.  Su sueño de la socia es abrir una clínica dental. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso a la junta directiva para llegar tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
A group of coworkers and friends formed Centro de Salud de Urubamba Communal Bank in the district and province of Urubamba.  The communal bank has been operating for six months and it's well organized.  The bank is made up of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, give their children a better future.  Most of the members are health professionals such as nurses, aides, and doctors.  All these professionals work in a health clinic in the city of Urubamba.

Flor María was born in the city of Cusco but currently lives in Urubamba where she works.  She's 41 years old and married, and has two children from this relationship.  She has been an oral surgeon for 14 years and it's going very well for her.  She works as a dentist in a health center but in her free time she practices independently, doing treatments, preventive care, extractions, and other procedures.

Now she needs a loan to buy amalgam, resin, and other work materials.

Her dream is to open a dental clinic.  The members in general are grateful for their opportunity and pledge to make their various payments on time.  (The member who appears at the bottom of the photograph asked the board permission to arrive late to the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy amalgam, resin, and other work materials

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” en el distrito del Cusco de la provincia de Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de materiales de construcción, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y otros brindan servicios de turismo. (La señora Maruja está levantando la mano en la fotografía). Maruja vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco donde realiza diferentes tipos de actividades. Su actividad económica principal de Maruja es la hacer fotocopias para esto tiene un pequeño local y varias fotocopiadoras. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maruja requiere el préstamo para comprar papel. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the "Juntas y Unidas" communal bank in Cusco district, in the province of Cusco. The communal bank has operated for several years now and is well organized. 

This communal bank is made up of people who continually seek opportunities to succeed, and through their daily effort to provide a better future for their children. 

The livelihoods of the members include: selling construction materials, selling cosmetics and selling food. Others provide tourism services. 

Maruja is raising her hand in the photo. Maruja lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, where she carries on various types of work. Maruja's main business is making photocopies, and for this she has a small shop and several photocopiers. She has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well. On this occasion she needs a loan to buy paper.

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided, and promise to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy paper.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny de 30 años, es una mujer muy hogareña y responsable, made de la pequeña Brithm de 5 añitos y su esposo Delfín con quien comparte varios años de pareja. Juntos logran conformar un prospero y calido hogar. Ella y su esposo, hicieron posible la construcción de su casa a base de material noble cuyo terreno le fue cedido por sus padres. Forzada a dejar el campo, cuya actividad consistía en la producción de cacao y café entre otros,  llego a la ciudad buscando ayuda para hacer frente al problema de salud que aquejo su hija, optó en adquirir a crédito un vehiculo mototaxi con el fin de iniciar una nueva vida. Afortunadamente a base de esfuerzo y algunas horas extras de trabajo cumplieron con todas sus obligaciones, pues esto los motivo a seguir con mas fuerza. Uno de los objetivos que tiene en mente es adquirir un auto y recorrer distancias mas largas, pues la demanda para el transporte de personas en la zona va en aumento y ello a futuro podría ayudar a cumplir el sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes.
Como todo vehiculo, en ocasiones presenta fallas, por ello desea tener dinero adicional para contrarrestar estos inconvenientes que tienen. Este es su octavo crédito y desde ya se siente muy contenta con la confianza que MFP le otorgo desde el inicio, por tanto se compromete como siempre a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Felicita a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por ser cumplidores de sus pagos.
Los 500 nuevo soles los empleará en la reparación emergente que requiera su mototaxi ante cualquier eventualidad, garantizando un trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Yeny, 30, is a very home oriented, responsible woman; she’s the mother of her little 5-year-old daughter, Brithm.  She’s been together with her husband, Delfín, for many years.  Together they form a prosperous, warm home.  She and her husband made possible building their house with substantial materials on a piece of land their parents passed down to them.  

Forced to leave the countryside where she worked growing coffee and cocoa beans among others, she arrived in the city seeking help for her daughter’s illness.  She opted for buying a mototaxi on credit to start a new life.  Fortunately, based on effort and extra work hours they met all their obligations and this motivated them to continue with still more dedication.  One of the objectives they have in mind is to acquire a second vehicle and do longer routes because demand for transportation by local residents is increasing and this could lead to her reaching her future dream of owning a grocery store.

Like all vehicles it sometimes has breakdowns which are why she wants to have additional money to counteract the inconveniences caused by them.  This is her 8th loan and she’s very happy with the trust MFP has granted her since the beginning which is why she commits like always to be punctual with her payments.  She congratulates her fellow communal bank members for being responsible with their payments.  She will use the 500 new soles for any repairs her mototaxi might need thus guaranteeing uninterrupted work.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old, married and supports a family of four people. He is a mixed crop farmer and has been in farming activity for the last five years earning a monthly income of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shilling). 


He is receiving his first loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to add up with his savings and purchase a combined harvester. Charles will use the machine for his farm harvest as well as for hire for this harvesting season in the area. 


The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase a combined harvester

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-five-year old lady, married to Daniel and the mother of four children.  She runs a general store, and also does dairy farming in the same area. Mary has been in this business for ten years, and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to add stock to her store for resale.  She will buy items like rice, maize flour, and sugar. 

In future, she wants to expand her business, open a wholesale shop, and educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To add stock of rice, sugar, and maize flour for resale in her general store.

loans.name: Transito De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora Transito De Los Angeles se encuentra realizando el quinto crédito en el banco comunal El Control, vive  por la comunidad de Punta Corral que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad ya que desde allí se puede admirar una gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio.

Doña Transito De Los Angeles tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del  hogar, su ultima hija está estudiando en una academia de belleza. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora Transito De Los Angeles pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en su casa dedicándose a los quehaceres de su hogar, también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y a la agricultura, sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para la crianza de pollos.

Su meta es realizarse una operación para bajar de peso para mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Doña Transito de los Angeles is taking out her fifth loan from the village bank El Control. She lives in the community of Punta Corral, which belongs to the parish of Turi in Cuenca and is known as the lookout of the city since it is from there that one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca. Its people make a living by breeding animals, as well as from agriculture and trade.

Doña Transito de los Angeles is 42 years old and married. She has conceived three children, who are 21, 19, and 17 years of age. Her first child, a son, is married and lives independently of her. Her second child, also a son, works and helps her with the household expenses. Her youngest child, a daughter, is studying at a beauty school. The house in which she lives is her own. 

Doña Transito de los Angeles spends most of her time in her house doing the household chores. She also makes a living from agriculture and the breeding of hens. Her harvested crops are for household consumption and she sells any existing surplus.

She is going to invest her new loan in the construction of a shed for breeding chickens.

Her goal is to have an operation to lower her weight in order to improve her health.

loans.use: to build a shed for chickens.

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “3 DE FEBRERO”  iniciará el ciclo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Placida es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos son: venta de verduras, kiosco, venta de artículos varios, venta de gorras, panadería, venta de material de construcción, venta de salchipapa, venta de ropa interior, tienda de barrio, costura de mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Placida es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio panadería; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace años, desde esa fecha ella trabaja en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The lending group "3 de Febrero" will initiate its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion [Focal Point of Town Exaltation], which is made up of ten member groups and is directed by a committee of directors, where Placida is the treasurer.

The businesses that the lending group members carry out are varied.  Among the businesses in this group, we have: vegetables sales, newsstands, varied product sales, hat sales, bakery, construction material sales, fried potato with hot dog snack sales, undergarments sales, corner stores, and sewing aprons.

The loan will benefit small microbusinesswomen, like Placida.  She says this is the first time that she will loan from Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a friend that is a member of our institution.  Currently, she has a bakery.  She says that she learned this business from her husband years ago, and she has been working in this business ever since.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (by purchasing flour) that she will buy from the distributors.  After production, she will sell her goods at her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible.  She lives with her life partner and has four children.
 
When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the consulting office.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 31-year-old married woman who has been in the work of sweater weaving for almost nine years. She works hard on her loom every day so she may earn a living for her family. She is a mother of three children and her husband is a worker in a government sector. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without any money. His heart was heavy with the burden of facing his family’s disappointed faces. Her children often slept without having any food. 

When Kashf’s loan officers found Shahida in these circumstances they informed her about microfinance and the facilities they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so she could start her work. She said she remembered doing it with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. Currently Shahida has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) to purchase bundles of wool and reels of thread in different colors for weaving. This enables her to meet with increasing demands during the winter season.

While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, Shahida said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To purchase bundles  of wool and reels of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 28-year-old married woman; she has been doing sweater weaving for the past 8 years. 

She offers various designs of sweaters in her community, and in the local market.  Razia is famous in her circle for providing good quality sweaters. She is happy doing this for the sake of her family. 

She is the mother of three, and is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing and education. She also sews as a part-time job. In this way, she is able to effectively handle her family's needs and requirements. 

Currently, she has requested for a loan of 20,000 to purchase bundles of wool in different colors. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said that since she started working on her own, her children have never slept without having a meal. 

She wishes to utilize part of revenues for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wool in different colors for her sweater weaving business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single man living with his parents and two siblings. He’s a 21-year-old hard worker, looking to help his father satisfy the family's needs. Ali’s siblings are still studying, even though they are ready to help whenever needed. 

Ali is an independent painter who works upon client’s requests; he has many years of experience in this job. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results. He’s known for being well-organized and punctual. 

He’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed tools and supplies for new paintings. He will be utilizing these tools in his new project; it will return higher profits to him.  

Ali is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he wants to take more projects, maybe outside the country, if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed tools and supplies for his painting business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and four children in their modest house, located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. His father works at a local company to cover the family’s household expenses. This is the reason of why Mohmmad started to work at an early age: he hoped to take some responsibilities off of his father. 

Mohammad spent the last three years repairing electrical equipment until he decided to open his own shop just next to his house. Mohammad earns a barely fair income because of the clients’ financial situations; this is the reason of why he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new repairing tools for his business. He confirms that these changes will help attract more clients, and thus increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase new repairing tools for his business.

loans.name: Khankishi

texts.en:
Khankishi is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Khankishi lives in the Fizuli region with his wife and children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the city of Fuzuli. 

Khankishi needs a loan of 1,700 AZN to repair his soldering-iron for repairing telephones and to buy merchandise (telephone cables, cell phone cases and parts) to improve his business. 

Khankishi has been in this business for the last seven years. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family.

This is Khankishi's second loan. He very thankful to Kiva and lenders for helping him to improve his business.

loans.use: repair his soldering-iron for repairing telephones, as well as to buy other merchandise to improve his business.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a loving mother of four children - two daughters and two sons. She enjoys her business of weaving rugs and shawls, which she started almost 10 years ago. She is very famous in her circle for providing various designs of rugs.

Ms Khalida is in charge of providing her family with bread and butter, as her husband's income alone is not sufficient to meet the requirements of six family members. She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. Because of her trust on this institution, she has again requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres. This will allow her business to flourish, which will ultimately help in bringing in more cash. 

She dreams of providing her children with good quality education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the Telavi district of the Kakheti region. She is 22 years old and lives with her husband, child, parents-in-law, brother-in-law and grandmother. Nana’s husband, father-in-law and brother-in-law are builders and get monthly income. The grandmother is a pensioner. Nana runs an agricultural business. 

In particular, she owns a plot of land, where strawberries are grown. In addition, the family has a vineyard and picks grapes in the late summer. They do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold locally. Also, Nana is involved in an animal husbandry business and has several pigs. She is a very hard working young woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

With the received credit, Nana will purchase pigs and food for them. Also, part of the credit will be used for the shed renovation. The existing shed is damaged and too small for the future expansion of the farm. 

Nana will place the pigs in a shed located in their yard, raise them and after several months the family will be able to have piglets. This will increase the family's animal husbandry business and their income as well. With the increased income, Nana will renovate the house and improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and food for them, and also, to renovate the shed

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is a 33-year-old married woman who has been in the business of sweater weaving for almost 6 years. She works hard on her weaving every day so she may earn a living for her family. 

Nazia is a responsible mother of four. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life; there were days when her children often slept without having any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the upcoming winter season, she has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase bundles of wool in different colors.  She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend the part of profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wool in different colors for her sweater weaving business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods of daily use at reasonable prices. She has gained a lot of regular customers.

Nasreen's husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income alone to support his family. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family.

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) to buy stocks of rice, flour and packs of oil from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Nasreen wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and also to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To  buy a stock of rice, flour and packs of oil.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
A water vendor since last year, Mina is a 33-year-old mother of four dependent children, all of whom go to school. Mina sells fresh water from her home and also has a kiosk selling basic household items.

Faced with ever-increasing demand, she is requesting this loan from Yehu to buy a larger water tank to sustain her water supply when the pipes are dry. Mina hopes to make the largest possible profits to ensure the continued existence of her business and maintain a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a larger water tank.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 50-year-old Lebanese widow; she lives with her five children. Two of them are working, and the others attend school. 

Fatima is working with double effort following her husband’s death. He was an essential support for her and for the whole family. But this wasn’t a reason for her to get disappointed and lose everything she worked for. Fatima carried on her life to support her children and cover their needs. 

She owns a small mini-market in her town. She has loyal customers who visit her from the neighboring villages. 

She is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her mini-market. In that way she will be able to diversify her items, and increase her revenues thus her way of living. One of her greatest dreams is to support her children with every step in their life, either morally or financially.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her mini-market.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Ms. Shaheen is 27 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. The man shown in the photo is Shaheen’s husband. 

Her husband also assists her by selling her designs in their community and to the local market. Shaheen makes enough through her business to support the needs of the family members. She is a mother of one daughter and wishes to fulfill all her needs.  

With the passage of time she has improved her business, now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee), to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income by carrying out orders on time. 

Shaheen desires to expand her business and, hence, can better support her family members.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is from the Telavi district. She is 41 years old and lives with her husband and a child. Her husband is a shepherd and shepherds their own twenty-one sheep. In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm of one milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Khatuna also owns a vineyard and picks the grapes in the late summer. She sells cheese and grapes at the local open market. Khatuna works hard to do her best for the family.
She requested a loan to purchase additional sheep. Khatuna will be able to have lambs after several months and she will expand her animal husbandry business. This will significantly increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in the family agricultural business and the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак женщина в возрасте 35 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Занимается она торговлей овощей и фруктов на местном рынке. Её муж помогает с перевозкой фруктов и овощей на своем автомобиле. Также он шафер и по ночам занимается услугами такси. Деньги которые зарабатывает муж все уходит на семейные расходы. Дети Муборак учатся в средней школе. Муборак очень хочет чтобы ее дети когда подрастут учились в высших учебных заведениях поэтому старается развивать свой бизнес и копит на будущее. Она планирует увеличить свой товарооборот и на полученный кредит хочет закупить фруктов и овощей.
texts.en:
Muborak is a 35-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She sells fruits and vegetables at a local market.  

Muborak's husband uses his car to help transport her fruits and vegetables.  At night, he also works as a taxi driver.  All of his income is used to cover the family expenses.

Muborak's children are high school students.  Muborak would really want them to attend institutions of higher learning when they grow up.  This is why she is trying to expand her business and save for the future.  

She is planning to increase her turnover of goods. She will be using her loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Le Progres 2 Group

texts.en:
Sylva, age 32, is married with three children, aged nine months to six years old. She has one child currently attending school. Sylva also cares for her nephew. 

Sylva is representing the Le Progres 2 group. She owns a butcher shop in her local market. She has had this business for two years. Sylva will use the loan to buy chicken and fish to sell in her shop. 

Sylva has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to improve her butcher shop and continue to grow it into a larger business. Sylva hopes her family will live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: Ms. Sarwar is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of selling milk for the past fifteen years. The man shown in the photo is Sarwar’s husband. He also assists her by selling milk to door-to-door. Sarwar has three cows for milk. In the beginning she used to purchase sheep and goats and then sell them near the eve of Eid-Ul-Adha (an Islamic tradition). Afterward, she purchased buffalo and cows to start the business of selling milk. She is efficient at her job and also helps her customers by providing cheese and butter along with milk. She has gained a lot of regular customers. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food and education. She has gradually improved her business and now requests a loan for 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers at a time. She wants to utilize her revenues on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 25 years old and supports four members of her family. She is blessed with three children, aged twelve, nine, and four. For two years, she has operated a farm, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  

She has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES. She intends to purchase farm supplies, such as vegetable seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay to have her land tilled.  

The loan amount will be used to improve the living standards of her family. She wishes to generate more income to enable her to diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es:
Macedonia es una mujer madre soltera de 39 años, abnegada a su vez de sus 3 hijos, Niker, Jennifer y Brayan. Como toda madre independiente tiene el deseo de ver a sus hijos culminar sus estudios superiores y así sentirse muy orgullosa. Juntos habitan en una vivienda de material noble que logró construir ella sola con el esfuerzo y dedicación. Anteriormente se dedicada a las actividades agrícolas, pero se le presento una oportunidad en el área comercial, que es la compra, y venta de bloques de madera que son extraídos de bosques constantemente reforestados. Desempeña esta labor desde hace 10 años, pues a lo largo de este tiempo le fue generando buenas ganancias permitiéndole también viajar a distintos puntos del país para personalmente realizar la entrega de la mercadería.
No obstante una de las cosas que dificultaban su normal desempeño comercial era el de proveer a municipios locales quienes presentaban serias demoras en el pago correspondiente generándole serios inconvenientes.
Tiene planeado seguir desempeñándose en este negocio, así logrará adquirir una camioneta para el transporte,ya que actualmente contrata a transportistas particulares, pues según comenta, el pago por el flete es costoso.
Al iniciar una temporada de extracción debe dirigirse a las zonas en donde realiza la compra al por mayor de los bloques realizando el pago en su totalidad antes que otros comercializadores se le adelanten. Este es su préstamo número 12, comenta que siempre le fueron de gran ayuda y en respuesta a ello cumplió de manera puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital de trabajo destinados en la compra de bloques de madera que posteriormente serán comercializados en distintos puntos del país.
texts.en:
Macedonia is a single, 39-year-old mother, sacrificing herself for her three children: Niker, Jennifer and Brayan. Like every independent mother, she has the desire to see her children complete a higher education and that would make her feel very proud. 

They live together in a house of good material that she was able to build alone with effort and dedication.

Previously, she made a living doing agricultural activities, but she was presented with an opportunity in the commercial area which was the buying and selling of wood blocks extracted from forests which are constantly reforested. 

She has performed this work for 10 years, and throughout this time she has been generating good earnings which have also allowed her to travel to different places in the country to personally deliver her merchandise.

However, one of the things that has made her normal business performance difficult was providing goods to local municipalities who had serious delays in their payments and caused her serious inconveniences.

She plans to continue doing this work, which is how she will acquire a truck for transport, since she currently hires private transporters, and as she says, the payment for freight is expensive.

When the extraction season begins, she must target those areas where she can make the bulk purchase of the wood blocks and make payment in full before other vendors get to them ahead of her.

This is her 12th loan, and she states that these loans have always been a great help and in response to receiving them she made her payments in a punctual manner. The 2,000 nuevos soles she requested will supplement her working capital which serves for the purchase of blocks of wood that will later be marketed across the country.

loans.use: to buy wood blocks

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a Lebanese married man. He’s 32 years old. He’s really attached to his family which is composed of his wife and three school-aged children. Cooperating together, Ahmad and his wife were able to cover their heavy expenses in order to live a proper life. He started his business at an early age. He had to work really hard to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanic tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: This is Nahida, a 37-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single, living with her only sister. They are both cooperating together for a new and better way of living. They have lots of expenses that can't be covered unless they both work hard. Nahida started her own business as a tailor from her home since 1994. She’s stylish, fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for her business. This will facilitate her transportation and allow her to keep the clothes in safe conditions once delivered to the clients. Nahida has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and augment her earnings. She’s planning to open her own tailoring shop and also expand her business outside the country as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her business

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en: Mwanapili is 36 years old, married, and lives on her own. She is a very hard-working woman who likes to fend for herself so that she can earn a living. She has a grocery store in the local market, where she sells foodstuff and other household items. She works every day from 7 AM to 8 PM, when her business closes. This loan is to buy bales of flour, basic grains, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, basic grains, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old. She is married to Kahariri, and they have four children. Lucy operates a maize mill and has been in this business for the past nine years.

This will be Lucy's first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase maize, which she will grind and later resell.

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase maize for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old; she is a widow and a mother of two children. Nancy is a dairy and crop farmer in Limuru. She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 44,000 KES.

This will be Nancy's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she wants to start selling milk in addition to crop and dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, 52 años de edad, viuda, originaria de León, madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a vender comida en especial platillos típicos tales como Nacatamal hecho a base de maíz, especies carne y pollo así como la sopa que son muy solicitadas por sus clientes. Al principio le ayudaba una sobrina pero después se fue de la casa y María se tuvo que hacer cargo por completo del negocio, tiene buena clientela que a diario le solicitan su famosa sopa y sus apetitosos nacatamales hechos de maíz.  
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar maíz, carne, especies, verduras, empaques para comida. Esto le permitirá tener más inventario para hacer sus platillos y atender a más clientes. 
Ella desea poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su negocio  y su casa.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and widowed. She is originally from León and has three grown children. She makes a living selling food, especially typical dishes such as Nacatamal, which is made with corn, spices, meat and chicken. She also makes soups, which are highly sought after by her clients.

At the beginning, one of her nieces helped her, but after she left home, María had to take charge of the business. She has good customers who come daily for her famous soup and appetizing corn-based nacatamales.

She needs this loan to buy rice, meat, spices, vegetables, and packaging for the food. This will allow her to have more inventory to make her dishes and serve more clients.

She hopes to keep improving the infrastructure of her business and her home little by little.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, spices, vegetables, and packaging for food.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a vendor who sells fish. Since starting his business in 2007, he has had problems running out of stock, and this directly influences the level of satisfaction of his customers. However, he is so grateful for the previous loan, which had a positive impact on his business and improved his general household. In order to solve this issue, he is requesting another loan with Yehu in order to strengthen his business. He will buy more stocks of fish.
He intends to invest the profits back into his business in order to be able to purchase refrigeration units for wholesale distribution.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 43 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged ten, seven, and two years old.  He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for a period of 13 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 monthly.  

He wishes to borrow KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. This is his third term loan after repaying the previous one successfully.  He intends to use this amount to purchase salt, sugar, tea leaves, soaps, powder and cooking fat for resale. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and invest in the business. He hopes to provide higher levels of education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of salt, sugar, tea leaves, soaps, powder and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio (pictured with his wife) and his family are traditional farmers who work neighboring fields as well for additional income. They are looking to reduce their expenses while increasing their yields and see their 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester as the perfect solution. Using the manure from his animals, Sergio will be able to produce his own renewable energy and fertilizer; he will become more self-sufficient, save money, and help the environment. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Salina is a 32-year-old married lady; she is blessed with three children, whom she supports. Salina buys wheat in the Narok area and sells it in other markets. She has been running her business for four years, earning a monthly income of 80,000 KES.

She has borrowed a second loan of 80,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase more wheat during harvest season for later sale. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-aged children.

Salina's dream is to improve her living standards and buy her own residential plot.

loans.use: to buy wheat for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu's desire for self-improvement and motivation to build a better future for herself and her life partner has lasted even through hard times. Mwanaulu is a hardworking, honest woman who has good relationships with her neighbors. She sells fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, and coconuts. 

Mwanaulu approached Kiva partner Yehu to request a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She is grateful for the support she hopes to get and assures lenders that she’ll repay the loan. Mwanaulu is confident that this loan will help her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor came from Venezuela seven years ago and is the owner of Kami Hair Boutique, a beauty salon in Miami. Victor always admired the beauty industry and owning his own business was always something he had aspired to. Victor decided last year that it was the right time to become an entrepreneur and purchased the eight-year-old boutique. While he manages the beauty salon, he also studies Hospitality Management, making him knowledgeable about client services that he can directly relate to his business. Victor’s business also provides jobs to 13 employees.

For Victor, his biggest success as a small business owner has been introducing spa and massage services to the hair salon. At the same time, his biggest challenge has been dealing with the increased amount of competition in the Miami area and the economic downturn that has affected many businesses. Victor is now planning to renovate and revamp his salon. This loan will help him complete three projects he has in mind: to purchase new furniture and equipment, paint the inside of the store and create a marketing campaign to attract new clients.

loans.use: to renovate his salon and pay for a merketing campaign

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, age 25, lives with her husband and her four young children. She works very hard to provide the best for them. Mariam sells new clothing from her home. 

She is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can have the necessary capital to invest. She will buy more bales of clothing. Her main priorities are to increase her sales and improve her earnings so that she can have a peaceful and happy life with her children.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
36-year-old Garik is married and has three children: two daughters and a 6-year-old son. Garik’s younger daughter is a first-year student at the Vanadzor Branch of “Mkhitar Gosh” Armenian-Russian International University. She studies in the Jurisprudence Department. 

Garik has worked as a driver for many years. Thanks to his occupation he is able to support his family. Garik is asking for a loan of 90,000 AMD to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester at the university.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester at the university

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, married to Joyce, and blessed with four children between three and eight years old.  He is a farmer practicing livestock farming. He has been in this sector for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of KES 2,000.  

Joseph has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This was his first loan, and he hopes to use the amount to purchase livestock feed and restructure his farm.  

The anticipated income from the farm will be used for educating his children and for their upkeep. His dream is to start a posho mill business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Chantheort

texts.en: Chantheort is 35 years old and the mother of five schoolchildren. To cover the daily cost of living for her children, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee. It is the only business that she has been with for 5 years. This is the second loan cycle for Chantheort with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She has used her past loan, which she has completely paid back, to manage her household in a good manner, especially to get decent food for her children. Now, she is seeking a new loan in the amount of 601,000 KHR. She will use this portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to have a larger crop yield, so she can keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina (pictured with her husband) and her family raise cows in an increasingly urban zone. The odors and flies associated with the resultant manure causes friction between her and her neighbors and also represent a wasted opportunity. With her 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Catalina will be able to process that waste to produce renewable biogas and potent organic fertilizer. Both of these resultant products will save her money, provide her with valuable resources, and help her reduce her impact on the environment. Concurrently, the system will dramatically reduce the presence of flies and odors on her farm - a welcome change for the neighbors. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa loan.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a biodigester.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco ha sido acreditado de KIVA a tenido un crédito el cual  pagado puntal.
Solicita este préstamo ya que el piso del patio y el portón están en muy malas condiciones y desea mejorar su patrimonio y tener un lugar seguro y que este en  buenas condiciones para que sus nietos puedan jugar cuando lo visiten y no corran ningún peligro.
El señor Francisco es maestro pensionado con una parte del ingreso que recibe será para pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso para el y su esposa, ya que sus hijos ya tiene sus propias familias.
texts.en:
Francisco has had a loan with Kiva, which he paid on time.

He has requested this loan because the floor of his patio and gate are in very poor condition. He would like to improve his property and to have a safe place in good condition, so that his grandchildren can play when they visit him without running into any danger.

Francisco is a retired teacher, and part of the pension he receives will go towards the payment of this loan. This is the source of income for him and his wife, because his children already have their own families.

loans.use: To work on the floor of his front patio and gate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a biodigester.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She has been running a school for the last 5 years. She has gained a good number of students and is respected a lot in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all her great efforts as her husband is employed in a motorcycle workshop. Both are working to meet the needs of their children. In order to accommodate more students in her school, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase new school benches and chairs. She expects more admissions as her school becomes famous in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: To purchase new school benches and chairs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a single man and 21 years old. He bakes bread and cake and sells them in Kiambu. 

George has been in this business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be George's first loan with KADET. He plans to buy a new oven for his business to increase his output. In the future, he wants to get married and also to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy a new oven for baking

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol, a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, is 40 years old and a mother of four children. Only two of her children are living with her; one is still young and another works at a rice mill earning a minimal income. Thol makes a living selling vegetables, and she has been in this business for 26 years, earning about 59,100 KHR per day. She is able to save only about 16,400 KHR after expenses. 

Thol is the leader in a group of two borrowers, and she has never borrowed from Kiva partner VisionFund before. Thol is going to use her entire loan portion to help her son to pay for his driver's license tuition fees and examination. She hopes that her son is able to obtain a driver's license so he can get a better job and help the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's driver's license tuition fee

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Ms. Nargis is 51-year-old married woman. Fifteen years ago, she started her own business of making wooden boxes and rails. She offers various sizes of rails which are used for the holy Quran (a holy book). She supplies to the local market and also sells in her community. She makes enough through her business. She is a responsible mother of four children, two of them go to school. Nargis is working hard to meet the needs of her family members. She has been associated with Kashf Foundation for five years and has gradually improved her business. Now she requests for a loan of 25000 PKR to purchase good quality wood and cutters of different types in large quantity to meet the orders on time. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality wood and cutters of different types in large quantity.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is 29 years old, married, and has three children. To support his family he works by driving his own motorcycle taxi. Every day he goes out to drive around the town, providing freight service, which allows him to earn a living. He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Nassoro works only until that time to avoid the robberies and risks involved with his profession. He has worked in this profession for more than five years; he thanks God it has always gone well for him.

He is requesting the loan to buy certain spare parts for his motorcycle taxi to give his customers better service. This is his second cycle with Yehu and he likes it because of how they work in the institution.

loans.use: to buy certain spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru:
Комилчон родился в рабочей семье, после окончания средней школы поступил в Медицинский Институт Таджикистана и окончил успешно. В настоящее время является заведующим Инфекционного отдела центральной больницы района. После распада Советского Союза его заработная плата не удовлетворяла для проживания и он с членами семьи организовал дехканское хозяйства, где занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Комилчон решил младщего сына обучать в системе здравоохранения и его отправил на учебу в Самарской области Российской Федерации. В настоящее время его сын – Бекзод является студентом 3 курса Самараской Государственной Медицинского Университета Федерального агентства по здравоохранению и социальному развитию.  
 Комилчон не в состоянии в этом году оплатить за учебу сына и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 долларов США для оплаты учебы сына. Он ждет вашу доброту, так как обучения  его сына зависит от вас!
texts.en:
Komiljon was born into a working family. After graduating from secondary school, he enrolled in the Medical Institute of Tajikistan and successfully finished his education. Currently, he is the administrator of the Infectious Diseases division of the district's central hospital. After the fall of the Soviet Union, his salary was not enough to live on and he, along with members of his family, organized a family farm where he grows crops.  

Komijon decided to educate his younger son in the healthcare system and sent him to study in Samara Oblast' in the Russian Federation. Presently, his son, Bekzod, is a third-year student at Samara State Medical University, Federal Agency for Healthcare and Social Development. 

Komiljon does not have the means this year to pay for his son's education. This is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2100 USD in order to pay for his son's education. He awaits your kindness, as his son's education depends on you!

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Mrganush village with her husband, son and daughter. Susanna's husband works at the local village hall, and her son attends school. Together with her husband, Susanna runs a farm where they keep pigs and hens, cultivate peppers, grow different types of fruit trees and keep a grape orchard. 

Susanna would like to develop her farm, for which she needs sufficient funds. In particular, she wants to purchase a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse and renovate it, which will allow her to create favorable conditions for growing peppers in the cold winter season. Susanna will also purchase fertilizer to prevent diseases, which have become common recently. In addition, Susanna wants to purchase a calf, grass for feeding it, and forage for the pigs. These investments are important for Susanna to keep running her farm successfully and gather a stable agricultural income.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, forage for pigs, grass, fertilizer, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and for the greenhouse renovation

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha de 33 años comparte una vida junto a Juan su pareja, ellos vienen desempañándose en conjunto con el único propósito de brindarle a sus pequeños José, Jhon y Anelhy un buena educación que a futuro les permita afrontar la vida sin tantas dificultades como la tuvieron ellos. Temporalmente ocupa un domicilio que alquila con el afán de a futuro poseer también su propia casa. A manera de crecer económicamente decidió junto a Juan quien se desempeñaba hasta ese entonces como empleado en un taller de vehículos, el de contar con un negocio propio para así asegurar el sustento familiar, es como desde hace 3 años cuentan con un taller de vehículos diversos  y paralelo a ello una completa tienda de repuestos que ella administra. Formando un equipo de dos personas ellos laboran con el objetivo de lograr en adelante hacer que el negocio crezca. Comenta también que el hecho de trabajar junto a Juan hace que su felicidad conyugal aumente haciendo de su trabajo uno de los mejores que ella haya tenido.
Al notar el incremento del parque automotor en su localidad ella requiere contar con una amplia  gama de repuestos así como la de lubricantes comerciales, es por ello que debe disponer de capital suficiente el cual le permita realizar el pedido con una semana de anticipación.
Uno de sus objetivos mas próximos es el de lograr abrir una sucursal en otra localidad cercana, de esa manera expandirse como microempresaria y también reunir dinero suficiente para concretar el sueño de la casa propia. Tiene la grata oportunidad de pertenecer por primera a MFP, por ello se siente muy contenta y a la vez comprometida con el pago de sus cuotas. Los 500 soles serán usados para complementar su capital de trabajo destinados en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como repuestos menores, lubricantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old, and shares her life with Juan, her partner. They have been working together with the sole aim of offering their little ones, José, Jhon and Anelhy, a good education that in the future will allow them to face life with fewer hardships than they had. 

Temporarily, they occupy a rented home, with the desire of also owning their own home in the future. In order to improve their finances, she decided, with Juan, who until that time had been working as in an employee in an auto repair shop, to have their own business in order to ensure their family's livelihood. 

This is how they have had a repair shop for various vehicles for three years, and alongside that, a well-stocked spare parts store that she runs. Forming a two-person team, they work with the aim of making the business grow in the future. She also says that working together with Juan to get ahead in life, makes their marital happiness grow. This makes her job one the best she has had. 

Noting the increased number of vehicles in her area, she needs to have a wide range of parts, as well as commercial lubricants. This is why she must have enough working capital available to allow her to place an order a week in advance.  

One of her shorter-term objectives is to open a branch in another nearby town, and this way expand as a small business owner. She also wants to raise enough money to make the dream of having her own house a reality.

She has the pleasant opportunity of belonging to MFP for the first time, so she feels very happy, and at the same time committed to making her installment payments. 

The 500 soles will be used to complement her working capital, which is earmarked for the purchase of merchandise for her business, such as small spare parts, lubricants, and other items.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo y su esposa tiene una hija que estudiando la secundaria, ellos son originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene ya mas de 12  años que adquirieron su vivienda y a la cual poco a poco le ha realizado mejorar. Actualmente le esta haciendo falta el cambio del cableado de electricidad de toda la casa. Solicita el préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de instalar todo el cableado en la casa.
El señor Guillermo es empleado de una maquiladora como jefe de producción, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa se dedica al cuidado y atención de su hija.
Desea mejor el patrimonio de su hija y que su familia este en un lugar seguro y protegido de cualquier accidenté.
texts.en: Guillermo and his wife have a daughter who is in middle school. They are from the city of Nuevo Laredo. More than 12 years have passed since they acquired their home which they have improved little by little. They still need to change the electrical wiring throughout the house. He seeks the loan because he does not have the money necessary to complete the improvement and to pay the person who would be in charge of installing the cable throughout the house. Guillermo is employed as the chief of production in a factory. He plans to pay for the loan with a part of his earnings now that his wife is dedicated to caring for and attending to their daughter. He desires to improve the heritage of his daughter and that his family will be in a safe place where they are protected from any accident.

loans.use: to change the lighting wiring in his home.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Mrs. Lhagvasuren is 45 years old and the female head of household with three children in her own house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her daughter Ganchimeg, age 24, works at a private company. Her son Boroldoi, age 20, studies at the university. Tushigbayar, the youngest son at age 12, is a secondary school student. She has been running a butcher shop since 2003. She has a lot of experience within the industry and has gained her customers' trust with her higher quality products, economical price offers and her excellent service. All her income is spent on family expenses and her kids' education. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is a hardworking, honest and diligent woman.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of animal sales and milk sales for the last 15 years. The man shown in the photo is Bushra’s husband. He also assists her in selling animals in the local meat market. At the moment, she has three buffalo and two cubs. She makes enough to lead a respectable life.  

Bushra is a mother of seven children, four of whom are school going.  His elder son also helps her in her business.  She is trying hard to meet the needs of the family members. She has been associated with Kashf for four years. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more animals such as small goats and sheep. She will look after them for resale in the local market. She wishes to spend part of her profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more animals such as small goats and sheep.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, una mujer de 28 años cuyo esmero por sacar adelante a su familia nunca se vio limitada por su condición de género, junto a Palermo, fiel conviviente. Lleva un rol de madre abnegada por sus dos hijos: Kevin y Yeny. Asimismo tiene el orgullo de haber logrado la construcción de su casa a base de material noble. Con buen tiempo de labor en el campo logró reunir capital suficiente para adquirir una tienda de abarrotes, en un ambiente de su domicilio recién culminado. Teniendo como apoyo principal a sus dos menores hijos viene desempeñándose con bastante motivación ya que ha notado que su negocio tiene tendencia a crecer de tal manera que tiene pensado ampliarlo a futuro. Considera que uno de los factores que ayudan al culminar el día con buenas ganancias es el trato y confianza que ella brinda a sus clientes, pues gracias a ello a logrado hacerse muy conocida y a la vez querida en su barrio.
Dentro de los productos mas consumidos en su negocio están las conservas y menestras, adicionando a ello los productos de común uso como el arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. Para ello viene recibiendo ofertas por parte de sus proveedores quienes por la compra al por mayor incluyen un descuento especial, pues desea aprovecharlos y así lograr obtener ganancias  extras en su negocio. Este es su préstamo número 14, como siempre considera que el cumplimiento de sus pagos le esta permitiendo obtener mas confianza el cual le permita a futuro acceder a un crédito mayor para remodelar su negocio. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de productos cuya oferta de precios es  ofrecida por parte de sus proveedores dentro de las cuales están las conservas y los productos mas comerciales como el arroz y el azúcar.
texts.en:
Virginia, a 28-year-old woman whose concern for getting her family ahead was never limited by her gender, lives together with Palermo, her faithful cohabitant. 

She plays the role of mother sacrificing herself for her two children: Kevin and Yeny. She is also proud of having built her own house with good materials. With a good amount of time working in the countryside she was able to collect sufficient capital to acquire a grocery store, started within the environment of her recently completed home.

Having her two young children as her principal support, she has performed with much motivation and she has noticed that her business has a tendency to grow in such a way that she has thought of expanding it in the future.

One of the factors that she believes helped her end the day with good profits is the treatment and reliability she offers her clients, since thanks to that she has been able to become very well-known and liked in her neighborhood.

Among the most consumed products in her business are the preserves and stews, adding to that commonly used products such as rice, sugar, eggs, etc. She has received offers from suppliers who include a special discount for bulk purchases, so she wishes to take advantage of them and thus obtain extra profits for her business.

This is her 14th loan. As always, she believes that the fulfillment of her payments is allowing her to obtain more trust which in the future will give her access to a larger loan to be used to remodel her business. With the 1,000 nuevos soles requested, she will purchase products whose sale price is being offered by her suppliers, among which are preserves and more commercial products such as rice and sugar.
