Every morning, she milks her three cows and prepares gallons of milk that her son takes to the market, but business was not always this smooth. A year back, Shameem had only one cow. Her husband works as a welder whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of a family of five. 

Life was difficult for the family, as expenses were high and income was minimum. The family was in such circumstances when Kashf’s loan officer found Shameem. After informing her about the organization's services, the loan officer discussed different business prospects for Shameem. Listening to the different opportunities being offered to her, she borrowed 20,000 PKR from Kashf and purchased a new cow. Over time, the family has been able not only to meet basic necessities but also to make additions to their livestock. They are also planning to send their youngest son back to school; he had to leave his education due to the financial crisis at home.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Les Disciples 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Faigh, 48, is married with 4 children ages 12 to 22 years old. 3 of his children are attending school. He is representing the Les Disciples 2 (#1) group.

Faigh sells bags and suitcases in a local market. He has had this business for 2 years. He will use the loan to buy bags and suitcases to reinforce his inventory. His business strategy is to sell suitcases of the best quality. His customers can trust that he sells only good, long-lasting suitcases. Faigh has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. In the future, he plans to open another business in a different sector like transportation or selling drinks. He wants to give his children the necessary education and training they need to be successful.

loans.use: to pay for bags and suitcases.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, a seller of food condiments in Nakuru town, used his previous loan amount to buy more stocks of condiments to sell. It was a profitable purchase, and he was able to repay the loan well and in good time.

This will be Godfrey's second loan term which he will use to buy more condiments. Since demand for his products is high, he anticipates making more profits with which he will pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Godfrey hopes to start a wholesale business, earn more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food condiments.

loans.name: Solon

texts.en:
Solon is 43 years old, married and blessed with two children aged six and 11 years old. He has run a Christian bookshop for the last year; it earns him a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

With a loan of 35,000 KES from KADET LTD, he plans to restock his shop with a variety of Christian books and tapes for sale.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to buy books and tapes for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 44-year-old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher in a government school and has been in service for eighteen years. With his salary, he has been able to build a house, educate his children and pay school fees for himself. In order to supplement his salary, he ventured into a motorcycle transport business, giving a motorcycle to hired driver who pays Joseph 80 percent of the daily earnings. He would like to educate his two children up to the University, complete his house, and buy land for farming. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as iron sheets and paint for his house.

loans.use: to complete construction of his house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged nine and 14 years old. She has run a retail shop for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

She has applied for a loan of  20,000 KES from KADET LTD. With this loan, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable goods, such as packets of salt, tea leaves, and milk for sale.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business for expansion. Her future dreams are to be successful in life and educate her children.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her business, which sells maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour for resale, helping Lydia to generate greater profits and care for her family. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her capital.

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio, de 42 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Bertha, con quien tiene 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió de su comunidad hace 24 años. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura, su familia es campesina por muchas generaciones. Posee terrenos agrícolas en Chuqui y Matará, que es donde nació. Ahí siembra maíz, fréjol y papa de toda variedad. Cuando comienza la época de siembra pasa día sumergido en el campo y la naturaleza preparando la tierra para la semilla, cuidando del crecimiento de los alimentos y brindándole mucho amor. Tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio de alimentos, gracias a ellos tiene una casita junto a su esposa a 25 minutos de la ciudad cercana, en donde comercializa y obtiene sus ganancias, aunque afirma que en época de abundancia vende sus cosechas a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde recibe más ganancias. Ahora desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos, ya que gracias al abono orgánico que compra puede producir alimentos de calidad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, en esta nueva oportunidad promete ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que el apoyo financiero que recibe le ayuda en dinamizar sus cultivos y mantenerlos nutridos.   
Demetrio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre su próximo sembrío de maíz, comenta que ya tiene preparada la tierra para su siembra.
texts.en:
42-year-old Demetrio is a hard-working man.  He lives in the company of his wife, with whom he has four children they care for in the house they acquired in their community 24 years ago.  Since he was very young he has made a living in agriculture; his family have been peasants for many generations.  He has farming land in Chuqui and Matará, where he was born.  There he plants corn, beans, and potatoes of every variety.  When the planting season begins he spends the day immersed in the field and nature, preparing the earth for the seed, caring for the growth of the food, and providing a lot of love.

He has more than 20 years of experience in the food business.  Thanks to this he has a little house with his wife 25 minutes from the nearby city where he sells and makes his earnings, although he says that during times of plenty he sells his harvest in the city of Huancayo where he gets more profit.  Now he wants to continue improving his plants because thanks to the organic fertilizer that he buys he can produce quality food.  

This is his second loan with MFP; with this new opportunity he promises to be on time with his repayments since the financial support that he receives helps him to put new energy into his crops and keep them nourished.  Demetrio will use the money to buy organic fertilizer to distribute in his next corn planting.  He says that he has already prepared the land for planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dorcah

texts.en:
Dorcah is fifty-year-old farmer in Kisii county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and eight children. Five of them are still in school. She has been in farming for three years producing maize, beans and napier grass* which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will help in increasing her income and improve her livelihood. She will also use the milk for consumption. She aspires to buy more cows to expand her business in the next five years.

Diseases and animal calamities are her major challenges in farming.

Dorcah is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its support.

 *species of grass native to the tropical grasslands of Africa which has a very high productivity as a forage grass for livestock and wildlife.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Les Disciples 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Claise, age 28, is a single father with two children, age 2 and 7 years old. He has one child currently attending school. He also provides and cares for his niece. 

Claise is representing the Les Disciples 2 (#2) group. He has been operating a pharmacy for one year and it is doing very well. He wants to use the loan to open a butcher shop as his second business. His business strategy is to diversity his businesses by having a pharmacy and a butcher shop. 

Claise has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He would like to buy a taxi in the future. He wants his children to be able to go to school and be successful.

loans.use: to open a second business, a butcher shop.

loans.name: Ulamnemeh

texts.en:
Ulamnemeh is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two children in small house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Altantsetseg, is 59 years old and has run a catering business since 2009. His son, Enhbold, is 28 years old and works in private company, and his daughter, Shurenerdene, is a college student. 

Ulamnemeh has been fishing since he was little boy with his father. He started producing smoked fish and his wife also sells his smoked fish. He is a hardworking and diligent person who says, "I want my younger daughter to graduate university and obtain better education to live better life." 

He is asking 3,000,000 MNT to cover his daughter's tuition and other school-related expenses.

loans.use: To cover his daughter's tuition and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old, married, and the father of six children between 1 and 17 years old. He owns tea plantations on his farm, which has been in operation for five years and earns him a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is his fourth loan; he has successfully paid off his previous loans. He intends to use the entire loan amount to buy green tea leaves from other farmers for resale. 

The profit will be used to pay his children's school fees and provide other basic needs for the family. He wishes to be self-sustaining and own a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres, es divorciado, y no vive con su paraeja hace 8 años y tiene cuatro hijos, tres ya no dependen de el, cuenta con una hija menor que se encuentra en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando cuatro habitaciones con paredes de estuco y el piso es de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer propietario en la linea de microbuses del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa viviendo al dia con los ingresos de su movilidad, es la unica actividad que tiene, a su hija menor le ayuda con todo lo que es su estudio y alimentacion, el solo corre con los gastos de educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería pues el quiere incursionar en la venta de parabrisas para movilidades y poder tener un ingreso mas y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Andres es adquirir una tienda de barrio por que ya es mayor de edad y no podra siempre estar manejando su movilidad y así poder mantener la estabilidad en su hogar.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Andres is divorced, and he has not lived with his life partner for eight years.  He has four children, and three of them are no longer dependent upon him.  He has a minor, school age daughter.  He lives in his parents’ house, occupying four rooms with stucco walls and cement floors.  The house is in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

He currently works as the driver of his own vehicle in the line of micro-buses in the Eduardo Avaroa union.  He lives day to day on the income from his vehicle.  It is the only business activity that he has.  He helps his minor daughter with all of her education and food.  He alone covers the educational expenses and the basic services expenses for his family.

He needs the loan to buy merchandise.  He wants to start selling windshields for vehicles.  He wants to be able to have another income and improve his income.

Andres’ dream is to get a neighborhood store because he is getting older, and he will not always be able to keep driving his vehicle.  This way he will be able to maintain stability in his household.

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wholesale windshields for vehicles in order to sell them at retail prices.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old married to Caroline, and they have one child, age 2 years. 

Moses raises poultry on his farm and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning an income of KES 12,000 monthly.  

He has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his second loan and he wishes to use the amount to purchase farm inputs for his farm and purchase more chickens.  


The profits he gets will be used as savings and start an alternative business in the future.He hopes to live a better live and prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and more chickens.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, 42 years old, blessed with four children, age 17, 15, 12 and 8 years old.  

He does motorcycle transport, which has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.  

He is now servicing his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use this loan to purchase spare parts and recondition his motorbike.  

The anticipated amount will be used to start an alternative business. He hopes for improved living standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Sumira

texts.en:
Sumira is a 26-year-old unmarried lady. 

A year ago, she started her own business of a beauty parlor in a small corner of her two-room house in order to fight poverty. Sumira works tirelessly to keep the business running because she plays a vital role in supporting her family. 

Her father is employed in a factory and is paid less than the family's expenses. Sumira’s siblings are not old enough to earn for their family. Sumira is gaining popularity day by day in her community. 

Sumira has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy some furniture and tools, such as hair dryers, rollers and streamers, to allow her to cater to many customers at a time. She is hopeful to earn more through her larger investment in her parlor. She wishes to provide a better life for her family members.

loans.use: To buy some furniture and tools, such as hair dryers, rollers and streamers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has been a horticulture farmer in Naroosura area for the past two years. His monthly income is KES 10,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase pesticides for the growing crops.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His future dreams is to have a stable business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a lady of thirty six years, married to Peter and a mother of three children. She has been keeping pigs for three years and gets a monthly income of forty thousand from the sale of pigs.

This will be Ruth's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy two big pigs. In the future, she wants to increase the number of pigs she is rearing.

loans.use: To buy two big pigs for sale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms Shabana is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of stitching since many years. She has expertise in the field of stitching and is famous in making attractive designs.  But Shabana’s business was not as successful in the past years as she had little resources.  Her five children were barely provided with basic necessities as their father was the sole bread earner and did not make sufficient income to support the family’s growing needs. It was in such challenging circumstances that Shabana borrowed funds from Kashf and invested them in purchasing raw materials required for sewing. Currently she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors. This will help her to meet the orders of her customers on time. She wishes to spend part of the revenues on the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man, 61 years old, blessed with seven children between 32 and 22 years old.  

He owns a retail shop in Kapsabet, mostly dealing with industrial goods. It has been in operation for a period of 10 years, giving him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is now servicing a loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. This is his second loan cycle after repaying the previous one successfully. He hopes to purchase five bags of sugar, four bags of rice and 10 cartons of cooking fat for sale.  

The anticipated profit will be used to educate his children. He dreams of starting a posho mill business in the same location.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of sugar, four bags of rice and 10 cartons of cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. 

For the past two years, Brendah has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. 

To help expand her business, Brendah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks for resale, and it will help Brendah to generate greater profits and sustain the family. Brendah hopes that in the future she will be able to develop the poultry farm and own more chicken farm houses. 

Brendah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for resale.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is aged 47 years and married with seven children, one of whom is a dependent and works as a garment worker to help support the family. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district earning a living through farming rice while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 38,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for their future needs.
This is Vy’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles. She successfully used the loans to support the paddy-field. Now leading her group of five to apply for a loan of 160,000 each, Vy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy materials for construction a proper latrine such as a latrine bowl, sewage and tile draining, etc. She hopes this loan will help her family have a healthy latrine for use.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a proper latrine

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 40-year-old farmer in Nymira county in Kenya.

He has been practicing mixed farming, producing milk, tea, maize and beans, which he sells at the local market in his area. Drought, too much rain, pests and diseases are some of his challenges in farming.
 
He is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, from which he will later make money to increase his income, and that will improve his business, which will help in improving his standard of living.

He believes that after repaying his loan, he will be able to get another loan from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es:
Lucho, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos dos  de cuales  están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como zapatero en un pequeño taller donde elaboran calzados para dama.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir material de  construcción (arena, cemento) y así poder refaccionar su vivienda ya que se aproxima la época de lluvia.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucho is married and has four children; two of them are school age.  They live in their own house in the Rio Seco area of El Alto.  He only went to school up to high school.  

He currently works as a shoemaker in a small shop where he makes women’s shoes.

He needs the loan to get construction material (sand, cement).  He wants to be able to repair his house because the rainy season is approaching.

This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the second time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to fix his house before the rainy season.

loans.name: Alfonse Taban

texts.en:
Alfonse is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 7. Two of them go to school. 

Alfonse runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Alfonse heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking out a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase okra, onions and many other items. In five years, Alfonse would like to expand her business. Alfonse says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like okra, onions, etc.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 39 years old and has three children living in Masindi, Uganda.

She operates a retail shop business and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

Her major challenges are price fluctuation and high competition. Her dreams are to educate her children up to the university and to own a wholesale shop to supply retail shops since they all have to go to the city to buy from wholesalers.

Robinah is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 36-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 13. All of them go to school.

James runs a business selling sugar, oil, etc. and has been in business for three years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase sugar, oil and other items. 

He has no other source of income besides this business. His major challenges include high market prices. In five years James would like to expand his business and open other branches.

James says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, salt and oil.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 45-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Masindi–Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely depends on him and his dream is to see all his children attain degrees as minimum qualification. For 3 years he has been in the transport business and the business is lucrative. He faces challenges of high fuel costs while his business dream is to own buses on the highway.

Alex is requesting the loan facility to buy a new vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new vehicle for his transport business.

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Thoern, 50, is a rice farmer in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and works as a garment worker in the local area. Thoern has been growing rice on one hectare of farmland for thirteen years while her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 12,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.  

Thoern’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and she is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she and her fellow group member would like to request a loan. Thoern is going to use her portion to buy materials to build a proper latrine, such as toilet bowls, tile for drainage, etc. Thoern hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer.  He has been in business for six years and dairy and poultry are the main products  though he produces maize, beans and vegetables as subsistence crops.  His dairy and poultry produce are sold within the local markets and are the major source of income to meet his family’s daily needs.  He also produces tea and coffee.

Peter has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds.  He believes this could improve his farming income and help him to educate his children as well as to improve his hotel business, which he runs within the local market to supplement his farming income.

Peter says animal diseases and undeveloped local markets remain the major challenges he faces in his farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Ghzala

texts.en:
Ms. Ghzala is a 34-year-old woman, running a business of cosmetic sales for the past five years. She started her business when she realized the fact that with the income of her husband she would not be able to manage educational expenses along with other expenditures. So, she purchased some cosmetics from a nearby shop and started selling at home with a profit of a few rupees. Then she accessed loan from Kashf and expanded her business by adding more variety to her collection. 

Currently Ms. Ghzala has accessed a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR to purchase more make-up kits, lotions and cleansers. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more make-up kits, lotions and cleansers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 29-year-old single lady and a mother of one. She has managed a tea farm in the Bomet area for the last two years. Her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).
 
She is currently servicing her first of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for the tea plantation. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to meet her family's basic needs. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her tea farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 51 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer in Narok for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES. 19,000. 


He has taken out a first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers, pesticides and manure.

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep-keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and manure

loans.name: Amigas De Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE BELLAVISTA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Cascada, está compuesta por Nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: repostería, venta de tucumanas, venta de salchipapas, venta de leche, confección de deportivos, venta de joyas de oro y plata, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tucumanas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde niña de su madre que realiza esta actividad, posteriormente decidió emprender por si sola su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y harina) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las unidades militares. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Bellavista” Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is made up of nine members and led by an executive board where Sra. Margarita is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank are successfully running are varied; among them we have sales of pastries, tucumanas (turnovers), salchipapas (a sausage and potatoes dish), milk, gold and silver jewelry, hardware and the production of sportswear. The loan they will take out will benefit their small businesses

Sra. Margarita states that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer and that she joined by invitation of a friend who is already a member. Currently she has a business selling tucumanas. She notes that she began in the business as a child with her mother, who is engaged in the same activity. Later, Margarita decided to start a business on her own.

The loan that she will take out is to increase the capital (to buy vegetables and flour) she will acquire from sellers by buying wholesale and later by making and selling her food to military units. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family since she is a single mother with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she enjoys the workshops on health and finance.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and flour.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is now a 50-year-old business lady and she is still in pig farming, a business that has improved. She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Alice will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. She hopes to own a big pig farm and become a leader in pig farming.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 5 to 28 years old. He describes himself to be a generous man. He operates a cyber café where he provides internet services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a potential business area and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to pay for internet connection  in his cyber café business. His business goal is to a successful businessman within five years. In addition, John does farming, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to pay for the internet connection

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: Cipriana, de 48 años, es una mujer fuerte y muy trabajadora. Enviudó hace 16 años, desde ese entonces cuidó de sus 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa que le otorgó su comunidad desde hace 20 años. Posee extensas áreas de terreno en su comunidad, gracias a su esfuerzo en la agricultura, actividad que desarrolla desde muy niña. Logró adquirir el soporte económico para criar a sus hijos. Siembra zapallo, maíz y papa. Además en su huerto de frutas tiene manzana, chirimoya y algunos cítricos. “Realizo cualquier actividad agrícolas para obtener el dinero necesario”, comenta. Tiene más de 20 años en la agricultura, toda su experiencia lo obtuvo gracias a sus padres y abuelos quienes también fueron agricultores. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de maíz y la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de zapallo, “estoy trabajando sin parar, contratando peones para que me ayuden, estoy segura que esta temporada será buena”, afirma. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, en esta nueva oportunidad promete ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que el apoyo financiero que recibe le ayuda a mejorar la calidad de sus animales. Además le agrada trabajar con su asociación. Cipriana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales, además de semilla de zapallo para su siembra.
texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Cipriana is a strong and hard-working woman.  She became a widow sixteen years ago and has since cared for her six children, two of which live with her in the home that her community granted her twenty years ago.  She has extensive areas of land in her community, thanks to her efforts in agriculture, an activity that she has carried out since she was a young girl.  

She has managed to acquire the economic support to care for her children.  She plants pumpkin, corn, and potato seeds.  In her fruit orchard she also has apples, cherimoya, and some citrus fruits.  "I do whatever type of agricultural activity to make the necessary money," she says.  She has spent more than twenty years in agriculture.  She gained all of her experience thanks to her parents and grandparents, who were also farmers.  

Now she finds herself in the corn harvest and preparing the land to plant pumpkin seeds.  "I am working without stopping, hiring laborers to help me.  I am sure that this season will be good," she affirms.  

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  In this new opportunity, she promises to be punctual with her repayments.  The financial support that she has already received helps her to improve the quality of her animals.  She likes to work with her association.  Cipriana will invest her money in buying balanced food for her animals and in pumpkin seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals and pumpkin seed.

loans.name: Sikweli

texts.en:
Sikweli is 51 years old and has two children. She is a married mother and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Msambweni, Kenya, with her children and husband.
Sikweli has her own business by which she is able to support her family. Two years ago, she established a firewood selling business selling door to door.
This is her first loan and she is requesting 30,000 KES so that she can restock her business with more bundles of firewood. This will improve her sales and her earnings. Her goals are to grow her business so that she can help her children with their studies and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to restock her business with more bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Toporu

texts.en:
Toporu is 42 years old, married and supports a family of six. He has been planting maize in Narok for the last 5 years earning a monthly income of 29,000 KES. He is servicing his second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Burhani

texts.en:
Burhani is 45 years old and has a common law husband with whom she has five children. Her husband is a businessman.
In order to earn something herself, Burhani operates a firewood selling business. She tells us that many people go to her house where she sells from. Burhani has been doing this work for four years and, thanks be to God, it has brought her a good income.
This loan will be used to buy more bundles of firewood for sale. Burhani's goal is to have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single lady, age 41 years old, and a mother of five children, ages between 10 and 20 years old. She practices livestock farming on her farm. She has been in operation for a period of 6 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  

Susan has borrowed a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This being her third loan, she intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow. The anticipated amount will be used to gather her family's basic needs. She hopes for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim was born in the town of Msambweni. He is a single gentleman of 30 years who lives in his own house. Salim's principal occupation is as a mototaxi driver. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts because his current motorcycle is in need of repairs so that he can provide a good service to his clients. He is thankful for the support he has received from this institution, this being his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Ms. Munawar is 42 years old and a married woman. A year ago Munawar started stitching clothes for the women in her vicinity. Adamant on changing her poverty-stricken life, she started her business with an old machine that she got in her dowry and some thread she borrowed from a cousin. Her husband’s income as a daily laborer was barely sufficient to meet her family’s expenses. 

She borrowed Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a new sewing machine. She is delighted to be able to make double the amount of clothes she made earlier. Her daughter, who will soon be preparing for her matriculation exams, uses the old machine to assist her to complete orders in less time. 

Munawar is able to provide her children a better lifestyle. With her added income she has recently bought a new fan to keep in the room of her old mother-in-law who is sick and bedridden.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children, 5 years and 12 years old. She describes herself to be a hard-working woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in an open, busy market  and her primary customers are local residents.

Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler, selling shoes to retailers and customers from environs  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will cater for her family's financial needs with the profit she will get from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 40-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, son and daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver while both of her children are students. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Safia is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothing. 

She has been operating her tailoring business very efficiently for three years, but she is currently in need of a new sewing machine, cloth and accessories as her old machine is not working properly. To do that, she has requested a loan as a member of a 10-person group from KIVA’s partner BRAC Pakistan so she can continue her business. With the profits she will pay household expenses and buy more sewing machines so that in the future she can increase her net income. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her family. 

Note: In the picture Safia is carrying a passbook in hand.

loans.use: To purchase new cloth and a tailoring machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, 48, is a mother of  four children and resides with her husband at Buchanan. Her children are between the ages of 9 and 25. Two of the children stay with her at home and are attending school, while the other two stay with their uncle. 

For the past 10 years, Oretha has been selling raw fish in the market. She makes profit when she sells because she always has her customers' favorite fish, cassava fish and bonnie fish. Oretha received the initial capital from her husband to start in this business, and learned to sell from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business, and hopes of becoming a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is a fifty-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For thirty-two years he has been farming bananas and with the income earned he has been able to buy more land for farming, build a house and pay school fees for his children. His major current challenge is the outbreak of banana wilt which has affected his plantation and his desire is to rehabilitate his banana plantation by increasing the quality and quantity of bananas.

Bruno is requesting a loan to buy more banana stems for planting and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy more banana stems for planting and pay workers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children at the ages of 1 and 2 years. She describes herself to be faithful and focused. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, onions, mangoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at a competitive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.  

Her business goal is to run a bigger grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will cater to her family’s financial needs with profits generated from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leri

texts.en:
Leri is from Telavi district of Kakheti region. He is 44 years old and lives with his wife, his mother and two children. Leri has a truck and takes wood from the forest. The wood is sold in his local village and nearby villages. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they grow peaches on family-owned agricultural land. 

The weather conditions were unfavorable this year and Leri lost his peach harvest due to a natural disaster. With the requested loan, Leri will purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat his plants. This investment will increase the quality of the harvested fruit and their potential price as well, raising the family's income. Leri plans to use the increase in income to renovate his house in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of two. She has had a business of pillow and quilt stitching for the past 5 years. She gets many orders from her community and also from the local market. Her husband is employed as a laborer in hosiery, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Four years ago, Bushra decided to borrow some funds from Kashf and improved her business by purchasing bundles of cloth. Currently, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as reels of thread and bundles of cloth in different colors to complete the orders on time. She shared her dream of running a small stitching school in her town. She is also interested in expanding her sales to the near cities of her community.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as reels of thread and bundles of cloth in different colors to complete the orders on time.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a dedicated woman who has the urge to get ahead in life. She continues working selling food and she counts good results out of it. The loan was helpful and on this occasion the request is in order to buy supplies such as rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc in order to prepare her food.

She feels happy that her business and clientele have grown and this is the reason her income has improved.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Etret's Group

texts.en:
Etret is a 45-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, son, and 4 daughters. Her husband is a carpenter while all of her children are students. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Etret is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothing. 

Since 1997 she has operated her tailoring business very efficiently, but she is currently in need of purchasing a new sewing machine, as her old machine is not working properly. To do that, she has requested a loan as a member of a 10-person group from KIVA’s partner BRAC Pakistan so she can continue her business. With the profits she will pay the household expenses and put aside some savings for her children's education. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. 

Note: In the picture Etret is carrying a passbook in hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sweing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline  is a 36-year-old widowed woman. She has two children, 12 years and 14 years old. She describes herself to be a very determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a slum area  and her primary customers are residents from the neighbouring slum. 

Pauline describes her biggest business challenge to be high tax charges charged on her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy curtains for selling. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy bales of curtains to sell

loans.name: Bere

texts.en: Bere is a forty-three-year-old widow with six children living is Kasese, Uganda.  She has been selling salted fish for twelve years.  Her major challenge is lack of appropriate preservation methods leading to losses.  Her dreams are educating her children to attain diplomas as minimum qualifications and buying a refrigerator.  Bere intends to use the loan to buy sodas, maize flour and fish to sell.

loans.use: to pay for sodas, maize flour and fish.

loans.name: Naputa

texts.en:
Naputa is 29 years old and married.  He supports a family of four children.  He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last two years with a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).  

He is servicing his second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.  

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest.  His future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Kivumba

texts.en:
Kivumba is married and has six children.  He operates a firewood selling business, a business he has done for three years.  He takes care of his small business alone.  He starts work as early as 7:00 a.m., and he works until 10:00 p.m. since his business is home-based.  The major challenge he faces is theft of his commodity since he sells from outside, in the open air.  

He says that in the beginning there was a lot of delinquency in his area, and there was not much productivity in his business.  Little by little these conditions have been improving.  Now his business is going very well for him.  His dream is to expand it in order to satisfy the needs of his customers.  

He intends to be selling through door to door.  This is the reason as to why he is asking for loan so as to buy a handcart for transportation of the firewood.

loans.use: to buy a handcart

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en: Kanze, 52 years old, is a married woman. She has three children ranging in age from 17 to 24. Kanze describes herself as a social woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells cherimoya fruits commonly known as 'Matomoko' in local language. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are mostly women and also local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 45,000 KES loan to buy more cherimoya to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future she will open a new retail shop selling home products . Kanze has been in previous business of selling brooms to retailers in her home area.

loans.use: to purchase more cherimoya fruit for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Kideth

texts.en:
Kideth is a thirty-six-year-old widow with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for two years. She also practices farming to supplement her income. Price fluctuations and high taxes affect her business while her desire is a wholesale shop and venturing into modern farming methods. 

Kideth is requesting money to buy rice, millet flour, maize flour, sugar and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy  rice, millet flour, maize flour, sugar and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BADEYA  est constitué de sept femmes dont six mariées et une célibataire ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Heremakono nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce céréales,  de fruits et légume, de boissons non alcoolisées ,etc.
DIALA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la la seule femme arrêtée dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de grains et légumes de toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 500Kg de maïs avec les paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BADEYA group is made up of seven women, six of whom are married and one of whom is single. The women in the group are, on average, 33 years old, and each of the women has, on average, two children. The women live in large, traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, and sons in the Heremakono neighborhood, north of the city of Bougouni. 

The women all met each other through neighbors, friends, and business. They joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better carry out their business. This is their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. The group sells grains, fruits, vegetables, non-alcoholic drinks, etc.

The group's president, DIALA, is the only woman standing in the photo. She buys and sells a wide variety of grains and vegetables, and she plans to use the loan to buy 500kg of corn from small-scale farmers. She sells her products retail at the market and from home, for cash or credit, to a clientele mostly made up of women.

She plans to earn a mean monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old, married, and supports a family of five members. She is a mixed-crop farmer who has been in business for eight years. Her monthly income is KES. 29,000.

She is currently requesting her second loan, of KES 30,000, from KADET LTD, which she will use to prepare the land and buy seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. 

Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is 39 years old, married, and has six children.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher, which he has been doing for nine years. Serving the community has always been his inspiration and he is glad to have achieved it. He supplements his salary with income from farming.

Ambrose is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy cement and sand to complete building his house. His dreams are to educate his children and build a permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for completion of house.

loans.name: Marcos Vicente

texts.es: Marcos vive en la ciudad de Manta de la provincia de Manabí está casado tiene 3 hijos los dos mayores  asisten a una escuela pública cerca del sector y el otro todavía no estudia. Marcos desde joven trabajaba como ayudante en el taller e carros de su tío, fue  entonces que  tuvo la ilusión de independizarse y ponerse su propio taller. En la actualidad lo consiguió El tine  su propio taller de vehículos y además  el contrato a un empleado para su taller. Ellos juntos trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde. Con el préstamo Marcos comprara herramientas y arreglara su local, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para poder contratar más empleado y así generar fuentes de trabajo para gente que no lo tenga
texts.en:
Marcos lives in the city of Manta in the province of Manabí.  He is married with three children.  The two eldest attend public school near the area, and the other has already finished school.  Since he was young, Marcos has worked as an assistant in his uncle's auto mechanic shop, but he wanted to go independent and have his own workshop.  Now, he has succeeded in this endeavor.  He has his own body shop, and he even has an employee.  They work together from Monday to Saturday from 8 am o 5 pm.  

With this loan, Marcos will buy tools and fix up his premises.  His dream is to increase his business so he can hire more employees and this generate work for people who have none.

loans.use: to buy tools and to fix up his premises.

loans.name: Daniel Trinidad

texts.es:
El  Señor  Daniel de 44 años, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 hijos en casa de habitación en la comunidad de San José Pespire, en la zona sur de Honduras, El se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de especias, achote, curry, azafrán, sal de ajo, canela etc., su negocio ubicado en su casa, el sale a vender diariamente a varias aldeas y comunidades y cada 15 días esta comprando su producto.
Don Daniel esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de condimentos, como ser especias, achote, curry, cubitos, sal de ajo y azafrán, El desea compra por mayor y almacenarlo y así poder obtener mas ganancias por la temporada navideña que es donde mas vende Con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende tener bien surtido su negocio para obtener mas ganancias 
Don Daniel su sueño es mejorar la su casa de habitación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the community of San Jose Pespire in the southern part of Honduras.  He has worked for seven years selling spices, annatto, curry, saffron, garlic salt, cinnamon, and others.  His business is located in his house and he goes out every day to make sales in various towns and communities.  He buys more products every two weeks.  

Daniel is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase condiments such as spices, annatto, curry, bouillon, garlic salt, and saffron.  He wants to buy at wholesale and store them so that he can make more profit over the Christmas season when he sells more.  This loan will allow him to purchase at wholesale and have a well stocked store to earn more income.

Daniel's dream is to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase spices, annatto, curry, bouillon, garlic salt, and saffron for his business.

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
Mayranush is from Yerevan. She studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University. She is in  the fourth course in the Faculty of Psychology and Sociology. 

Mayranush lives with her parents and two brothers. Mayranush's elder brother is in the Police Academy, and her younger brother attends school. Mayranush's parents are the main breadwinners in the family, and it's hard for them to cover their children's educational costs with the current income they earn. So, Mayranush is asking for this loan of AMD 250000 to pay her tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Las Angelitas Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo las Angelitas, mujeres emprendedoras y con energía para llevar sus negocios.
Entre sus integrantes se encuentra Blanca Nelly, mujer, madre de dos niños y dueña de su negocio.
Ella hace cerca de un año inicio con la inquietud de emprender un negocio y se decidio por la venta de tacos a vapor. Para esto, empezó por vender en la vía pública, luego rento un triciclo para moverse con mayor facilidad. 
Ella ha decidido comprometerse con un crédito para adquirir y acondicionar su propio triciclo y asi, hacer crecer su negocio.
Blanca, mujer perseverante,  convencida que su negocio va para adelante.
texts.en:
They are Las Angelitas Communal Bank, women who are enterprising and have the energy to run their businesses. Among the members is Blanca Nelly, a mother of two children and owner of a business.

About a year ago Blanca was anxious to start a business and decided to sell steamed tacos. She began by selling on a public road and then rented a tricycle so she could move about with greater ease. She has decided to commit to a loan in order to acquire and equip her own tricycle and thus grow her business. 

Blanca is a determined woman who is convinced that her business will succeed.

loans.use: to invest in a tricycle in order to sell steamed tacos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Consalata

texts.en:
Consalata, 32, is a widow  blessed with three children ages 13, 9 and 6. She has operated a boutique and cultural clothing shop for 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more clothing for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en: Alisa lives in Dalar village, in Ararat region, with her husband, son and mother-in-law. Alisa works at local village hall as a librarian and helps her husband with agriculture. The main source of income for the family is agriculture, and it is not sufficient for Alisa to save for her son's education. Her son is in the 2nd course in the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, at Yerevan State Engineering University. This loan will give Alisa an opportunity to pay her son's tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition for the first semester of his second year, studying Mechanical Engineering.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama, 40, is very enterprising and responsible. She lives with her husband and four children. Salama makes garments for men, women and children, including blouses, skirts and uniforms. Because she lives pretty far out of the way, she wants to do some publicity for her dressmaking workshop so that more people will get to know her and come to her with work orders. This is why she is requesting a loan from Yehu. In addition, she will buy fabric and a new sewing machine so that she will have what she needs to accept new clothing orders.

loans.use: buy fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 45 years old and married. He supports a family of six children. He is a horticulture farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 28,000. He is requesting his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD to help him purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His dream is to improve his family's living standards and to educate his children

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 38 years old and sells fruits and vegetables, such as potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, etc, from a vending stall in the town of Msambweni. She has been in this business for quite some time. This is her first loan with Yehu.

Sophia will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. She faces challenges in her business from the competition, but she works extremely hard so that she can help her loved ones move forward. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she can continue expanding so that she can provide more products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Gelly Cristina

texts.es: Gelly  vive en el sector norte llamado las Orquideas de la ciudadad de Guayaquil. Ella tiene 36 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo de 9 años que  estudia en una escuela pública del sector. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Gelly comenzó con la ilusión de tener un negocio propio fue ahí que  su esposo con un dinero ahorrado le compro mercadería. En la actualidad ella se dedica  al comercio ella le vende a sus amigos y familiares. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8 de la mañana hasta la 4 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería como planchas, repostero, vajillas etc. Su sueño es tener un local propio y ya no vender en las calles.
texts.en:
Gelly lives in Las Orquideas, the northern sector of the city of Guayaquil. She is 36 years old and married. She has one 9-year-old son who attends a public school in the area. Her husband works as a security guard.

Gelly began with the dream of having her own business, and then her husband bought her merchandise with some money he had saved. Now she dedicates herself to her business and sells to her friends and relatives. She works Monday to Friday from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise such as irons, kitchen shelving, dishes, etc.

Her dream is to have her own store and not sell on the street anymore.

loans.use: to buy irons, kitchen shelving, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en: Stephene is 48 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is a carpenter in Narok and has been running the business for the past 16 years, making a monthly income of KES 25,000. He has requested a fourth loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD to purchase new carpentry tools and lumber for work. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools and add lumber.
